loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school. 

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ermelina

texts.en:
Ermelina works hard to support her family. Ermelina is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ermelina requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ermelina has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Ermelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred supplies eggs to the local businesses in Mombasa, which then sell the eggs in retail. He has been in the business for one year now and the business is growing. This is his sole economic activity and he has dedicated his efforts here. He is 29 years old and single. He wants the business to grow in the next five years and be able to employ more youths. The major challenge that the business faces is bad debts. He knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy more trays of eggs to add into the business. Extra income raised from the business will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy trays of eggs to supply to local businesses.

loans.name: Maman Zaka

texts.en: Maman is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Chino Village of Kaduna.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to learn a new system of planting maize.  Like all Babban Gona members, Maman has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, she hopes to educate her children, and this loan helps her on her way to achieving these dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and for her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a hard working farmer in her village of Tsirya.  As a Babban Gona member she is most excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to improve her standard of living.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and allowing her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a hardworking maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Marmara Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further and moving from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to continue using his profits to send his children to school.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for vegetable production.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida, aged 35, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a welder by profession, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase some welding equipment. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. 

He doesn’t have enough funds to purchase the things he needs. Therefore his wife, Farida, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will be purchasing some important welding equipment including a welding machine, wire brush and welding holder. Farida is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding equipment including a welding machine, wire brush and welding holder

loans.name: Zonite

texts.en:
Zonite works hard to support her family. Zonite is married and has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Zonite requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Zonite has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Zonite would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en:
Chingiz lives in Baku with his family. He is 32 years old, married and has two sons. His sons go to preschool and school. They want to be a fireman and a footballer. 

Chingiz started his car repair business one year ago. Now he needs a loan of AZN 1,000 to buy painting equipment. 

He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Chingiz wants to repair his workplace. This will be more profitable for his business. 

Chingiz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy painting equipment

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 57 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Wilma has been buying and selling livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru is a hardworking and dedicated farmer in Nakala village, Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to increase his income and improve his standard of living.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dream of being economically prosperous.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samalia is a farmer, and a member of Babban Gona.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to making enough money in order to pay for his children’s school fees and to adequately feed them.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is a hardworking father, farmer, and a member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to educating his children whom he considers his pride and joy.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams of developing himself and achieving higher yields.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with high quality fertilizer and bags of Aflasafe, which protects maize from toxins, for his farm.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a 50 year old father of four, a maize farmer, and a member of Babban Gona.  He is excited for the opportunities Babban Gona offers him including providing him with the right inputs at the right time for his farm.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  

Suleman, like all fathers, is concerned about the well-being of his children and family.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to build a home and ensure his children are well educated.  He is on his way to achieving these dreams with this loan.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.  

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en:
Adeela, age 35, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money he finds it difficult to do so. 

For that reason his wife Adeela is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. Adeela is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, frozen foods, rice, beverages, noodles, soaps, candies, seasonings and more.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 47-year-old married woman, and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. 

Josephine has been in the hog raising business for more than three years; her husband works as a farmer. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

Angelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc..

Angelita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and also earns an income from selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is 29 years old, married and has a daughter. He lives in the Baku region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His daughter is 2 years old.

Anar started his bakery business 9 months ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to increase the work place and build a new "Tandir" (a special place for baking bread in Azerbaijan).

In the future, Anar wants to buy a kneading machine. This will be more profitable for his business. Anar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to increase the work place and build a new "Tandir" (a special place for baking bread)

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a 32-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs financing to purchase a variety of clothes to sell in the market at a profitable price. For that, Aneela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband so that he can respond quickly to customer needs.

With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings amount to pay for electricity and gas bills. Aneela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Jester

texts.en:
Jester lives in the Mombasa area where she operates a retail shop. She started the business four years ago. She is 55 years old, widowed and blessed with eight adult children. The challenge she faces is the new design of products from wholesalers which makes it hard for her to sell.

She knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy stock of flour, rice, cooking oil and salt for the business. The income that comes from the business will improve her living standards and add more product lines to her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, rice, cooking oil and salt

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 42 years of age, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a banana plantation in their village for almost 25 years. In this business she's earning a net income of 2,500 PHP every 2 weeks.

Due to lack of capital she wanted to request a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP to purchase banana seedlings and fertilizers. She's hoping that her banana plantation will improve and expand to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase banana seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elnora works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Elnora is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like chips, sugar, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like chips, sugar, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Arnaldo nasceu na Província de Maputo, tem 43 anos e é pai de 6 filhos que vão a Escola. Vive numa casa alugada com a sua família.
Trabalha no processamento de água como engarrafador há mais de 7 anos e aufere mensalmente um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e na sua nova casa que está a construir para si e para a sua família. Com o valor solicitado pretende comprar material de construção como cimento e pedras para dar continuidade à sua obra. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku e o anterior foi também usado para a mesma finalidade.
O seu maior sonho é mudar-se para a casa nova e sair da casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Arnaldo comes from the province of Maputo. He's 43 years old and has six children who attend school. He lives with his family in a rented house.
He has worked in water processing as a bottler for over seven years. He earns a monthly income which he uses to pay for his household expenses and for the new house that he's building for himself and his family. With the requested amount he intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement and rocks so he can keep the construction work going. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and the previous loan was also used for the same purpose.
His biggest dream is to move into the new house and out of the rental house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement and rocks so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a hard-working mother. She owns and manages a small variety store in her community and, because life is very hard, would like to improve her business. Josephine is requesting for a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy more groceries, vegetables and fruit to sell to her customers. Despite her problems and difficulties, she is determined to get ahead and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adalia

texts.es: Doña Adalia es una madre de familia, ella ha mantenido a sus hijos sola haciendo trabajos a domicilio. actualmente el ingreso no le alcanza para darle de comer a su familia por lo que ha tenido que viajar mas y trabajar durante mas hora. ella solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder comprar una motocicleta y así poder viajar con mas rapidez y poder conseguir mayores ingresos, los cuales le van a permitir obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Adalia is a single mother. She has provided for her children alone, working as a domestic helper. Currently, her earnings are not enough to feed her children, so she has had to travel farther and work longer hours. Adalia is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Costa Rican colones in order to buy a motorcycle so that she can commute faster and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, three of whom still attend school and one who is underage. She lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business selling clothes, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons and competition from other clothing sellers. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for both women and children for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for both women and children for resale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, milk, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, chips, milk, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo, a sus 49 años de edad es casado y padre de 1 hijo. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a trabajar como empleado en diferentes litografías y así ha generado los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Desde el año 2000, aprovechando su experiencia y con el apoyo de créditos, montó su propia litografía, con la cual hoy en día genera 3 empleos directos, esto le ha permitido continuar trabajando como empleado en otra litografía pero sin descuidar su negocio. De esta manera complementa sus ingresos para poder brindar educación superior a su hijo y poder solventar los gastos de su familia. 

Raimundo es un hombre pujante, activo, responsable y lucha cada día para salir adelante. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos (papel, crayones litográficos, tintas, goma árabe, cartón) y realizar mantenimiento a las máquinas, con esto podrá mejorar el funcionamiento de su maquinaria y tendrá disponibilidad de materia prima para ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad y satisfacer las necesidades, esto se verá reflejado en el aumento de su producción y en la entrega oportuna de los pedidos, lo que conlleva a tener más contratos e incrementar la entrada de recursos para seguir adelante con su negocio, y cumplir el sueño de hacerla crecer para generar más oportunidades de empleo y brindar mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida a su esposa y a su hijo.
texts.en:
Raimundo is 49 years old. He is married and the father of one child. He has spent his whole productive life working as an employee in different lithography companies and that is how he has generated income to support his family. Since 2000, using his experience and with the support of loans, he opened his own lithograph company. With it, he generate 3 direct jobs. This has allowed him to continue working as an employee in another lithograph company without neglecting his own business. This way, he supplements his income in order to be able to pay for his household expenses. 

Raimundo is a driven, active, responsible man who fights every day to get ahead. He is asking for the help of this loan to invest in buying materials (paper, lithographic crayons, inks, gum arabic, and cardboard) and to do maintenance on the machines. With this, he will be able to improve the functioning of his machinery and he will have raw materials to offer his customers more variety and fill their needs. This will be reflected in the increase in production and in the timely delivery of orders. This will lead to him having more contracts and increase the amount of resources to continue with his business. This will make his dream come true of generating more employment opportunities and offer a better well being and living conditions for his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy materials (paper, lithographic crayons, inks, gum arabic, and cardboard) and to do maintenance on the machines.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 46-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children; she loves her family, and her husband works very hard to meet the needs of the family. He owns a chicken shop, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Presently he is need of funds to purchase chickens from the farm and sell them in the market. So his wife, Salma, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help, so he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit, he will put aside some savings for their children's future. 

Salma hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase chicken to sell.

loans.name: Alkasim

texts.en: Alkasim is a devoted farmer from Hayin Mallan Yako village in Kaduna.  He cultivates maize on his farm and as a member of Babban Gona he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, double the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  He is excited about the opportunity Babban Gona provides him which will enable him to have enough food and money for his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en: Ya'u is a 50-year-old farmer from Hayin Mallan Yako village in Kaduna.  As a maize farmer, he is devoted to his occupation.  He is also a member of Babban Gona and, like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  Ya’u looks forward to having enough food and money to support his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving this dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him high quality fertilizer and Aflasafe, which protects maize from toxins, for his farm.  These inputs ensure that he optimizes his yields, enables his family to eat healthier maize, and helps him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is a devoted husband, father and maize farmer from Hayin Mallan Yako village in Kaduna.  He is also a member of Babban Gona and, like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  As a farmer, he looks forward to harvesting enough food for his family’s consumption and to sell.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Dan'asabe

texts.en: Dan'asabe is a farmer, a father, and a member of Babban Gona.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him and most especially the access to quality agricultural inputs.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to making enough money, “farming big,” and having enough food for his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Haffisu

texts.en: Haffisu is a devoted and diligent 27-year-old farmer from Ango village in Kaduna.  As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him.  He has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to making money and growing his farm.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving that dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji is a hardworking maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Ango Village of Kaduna.  At 75 years of age, he remains dedicated to farming his land.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to produce enough food for his family’s consumption while making profits through the sales of his produce.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Haladu

texts.en: Haladu is a hardworking dedicated maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Ango Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to growing his farm further and moving from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to increase his yields in order to have enough food for his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving that dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en: Matiyu is a diligent maize farmer, father of 5, and a member of Babban Gona.  As a member of Babban Gona, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Matiyu is excited about the opportunity to get quality inputs which he can use on his farm to increase his yields and earnings.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to expand his farming operation and educate his children, and this loan sets him on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Vasco

texts.pt:
Vasco nasceu no Distrito de Magude, na província de Maputo. Tem 29 anos de idade e vive maritalmente na casa própria com a sua família. É pai de 1 rapariga e responsabiliza-se também pelos seus 2 irmãos que vivem com ele em sua casa.
Tem uma propriedade de terra na parte traseira da sua casa e aí trabalha com terra há mais de 10 anos. Com o valor solicitado pretende comprar variedades de semente tais como: pepino, alface e feijão verde, para fazer o plantio de outras culturas que não possui em suas terras. Este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku para agricultura.
Pretende futuramente ser um grande produtor de morangos ao nível do Distrito, e fornecer ainda a cidade capital (Maputo).
texts.en:
Vasco comes from the district of Magude, province of Maputo. He's 29 years old and married, and lives with his family in a house that he owns. He has a daughter and he's also responsible for his two brothers who live with him in his house.
He owns a plot of land in the back of his house, and there he has worked in farming for over 10 years. With the requested amount he intends to purchase a variety of seeds such as cucumber, lettuce and green beans, so he can sow other crops that he currently doesn't grow on his land. This is his first loan for agriculture with Hluvuku.
In the future he plans to become a great producer of strawberries in the district and a supplier to the capital city (Maputo) as well.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds such as cucumber, lettuce and green beans, so he can sow other crops that he currently doesn't grow on his land.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 41 años de edad; vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Julio de de 51 años y sus 04 hijos.
Es una mujer muy laboriosa, se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de productos comestibles en su hogar.
Se siente muy identificada con el campo ya que es una actividad que lleva realizando hace 10 años. Durante las mañanas recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo; ella se siente contenta ya que aprendió está actividad cuando era muy joven, tratando siempre de obtener buenos productos.Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Fertiliza constantemente el suelo de sus parcelas con abono orgánico y esto le permite mantener los nutrientes naturales de sus terrenos de cultivo. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sean hombres de de bien y obtengan una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Catalina, age 41, lives in her own house with her husband, 51 year old Julio, and their four children.  She is a hard-working woman.  She devotes herself to farming and selling food products at her house.

She really identifies with the field because it is a business activity that she has been doing for ten years.  In the mornings she gets help from her children and her husband.  She is happy because she learned this business activity when she was very young, and she always tries to get good products.  Thanks to this business activity, she has managed to improve her quality of life.

She constantly fertilizes the soil on her land with organic fertilizer.  This allows her to keep the natural nutrients on her farmland.  

The thing she yearns for the most is for her children to become good men and that they have a better quality of life.  This is her second loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support she is getting in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She now wishes to have 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires, inner tube, sprockets, gasoline, and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora  Juana  de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo, en casa  de habitación,  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en  la zona  sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, pan, venta de madera para muebles.
Doña  Juana  es una mujer emprendedora que desea sacar adelante a sus hijas que está estudiando, es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación ya que gracias a sus actividades a podido sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña  Juana  está solicitando 15,000.00  lempiras para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y matas de madera  de color para revéndelas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para surtir su negocio y de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida.
Doña  Juana  su sueño es tener una mejor vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Juana, age 40, lives with her husband at their house in the San Lorenzo community in the southern part of Honduras.  She has been selling tortillas, bread, and wood for furniture for ten years.

Juana is an enterprising woman who wishes to get her daughters, who go to school, ahead.  She is an example of work and dedication because, thanks to her business activities, she has been able to get her family ahead.

Juana is requesting 15,000 lempiras to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, and colored woods used in making furniture in order to resell it.  With the support of this loan she plans to stock her business.  This way she will have better earnings and improve her living conditions a little.  Juana’s dream is to have a better house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July, 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, and colored woods used in making furniture.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 28 años , esta casada y vive junto en su esposo en su casa construida a base de adobe.
Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, por está razón tiene una tienda en su hogar el cual ha logrado consolidarlo y convertirlo en un buen sustento para su familia. Gracias a su negocio se ha convertido en una vecina  muy conocida, de está manera ha logrado captar más clientes. Dentro de su negocio podemos hallar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, cereales entre otros complementándolo  con la venta de balones de gas. Tiene planeado construir su vivienda a base de material noble para ampliar su negocio en un local más acogedor. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar productos y seguir surtiendo su negocio con galletas, gaseosas y conservas de pescado ya que son de buena demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old, married, and lives together with her husband in their home built from adobe. 

Elizabeth works selling groceries.  She has a store in her home, which she has succeeded in establishing and converting it into support for her family.  Thanks to her store she has become a well-known person in her neighborhood, which has gained her more customers.  She stocks her store with basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, cereal, and others.  In addition, she sells gas cylinders.  She plans to build her home from wood in order to expand her business to be a more recognized place.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to move forward.  She promises to make her payments punctually.  She is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase products and continue stocking her store with cookies, soft drinks, and canned fish, which are of high demand at her store.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, soft drinks, and canned fish.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
As the married parent of four children, Merilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Merilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Vergie has been in this business for three years; she earns more income from farming/selling vegetables.

Vergie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make into dried fish

loans.name: Claudio Aniceto

texts.es:
Claudio tiene 83  años de edad, es soltero,   tiene un hijo, vive con su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.


Claudio vende ropa y también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  Las  compras lo realizan  en  Guayaquil  cada semana.   Su sueño es seguir con la agricultura. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Claudio is 43 years old. He is single and has a son. Claudio lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. 

The members of  VRC San Antonio communal bank group all work in agriculture and raising livestock. They live in the Recinto Aguas Frías sector and practically grew up in this area.

Claudio sells clothing as well as makes a living in agriculture, growing corn. He is requesting this loan in order to buy fertilizer, supplies, and compost. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizers at a discount price for paying in cash. He will travel to Guayaquil each week to make the purchases. Claudio's dream is to continue farming. His biggest obstacles are plagues that affect his crops. In his free time, Claudio likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies, and compost.

loans.name: Angel Bricenio

texts.es:
Ángel 28  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre,   tiene cuatro   hijos, vive con su esposa e  hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

 
La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cría pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas cada semana.   

Su sueño es seguir con la agricultura. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ángel is 28 years old and lives in a common-law marriage.  He has four children and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.  

The members of the San Antonio community bank work in agriculture.  They all live in an area of the town of Aguas Frias and practically have grown up in that area.  The majority work as farmers or fishermen.

Ángel works in agriculture.  He plants corn and raises chickens.  He is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, supplies, and manure.  With the support of the loan, he will be able to purchase fertilizer.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every week.  

His dream is to continue farming.  He faces challenges such as disease.  In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, supplies, and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 55-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in the Kwatau Village of Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes he and his family will be able to live a healthier life with enough food at home, and this loan is helping him to achieve this dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en: Laazarus is a hardworking maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  As a member of Babban Gona, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He is excited about the opportunity to get quality increases to his yields and earnings.  With these increases, he hopes to expand his farming operation while producing enough food for home consumption.  With his loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Dije

texts.en: Dije is a 35-year-old hardworking farmer from Kwatau village of Kaduna.  As a Babban Gona member, she is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to improve her yields and move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  She hopes she can continue to farm, grow her farming operations and produce enough food for her family.  With his loan, she is on her way to achieving these dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and allowing her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yield and income

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma Village, Kaduna.  He is known by the members of his community to be a hardworking and industrious maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his yields and move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Jonathan plans to use his increase in income to expand his farm and provide an improved livelihood for himself and his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Rashidu

texts.en: Rashidu is a 30-year-old maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state.  He is a diligent farmer that takes great pride in his farm.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his yields and move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He dreams of a profitable farming operation which allows him to cultivate a larger farm, and this loan is helping him on his way to achieving that dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Jushua

texts.en: Jushua is a dedicated farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna State.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his yields and move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Babban Gona provides him the opportunity to double his yield by giving him access to high quality inputs as well as advice from seasoned agronomists.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He plans to use his increased income to expand his farm and provide an improved livelihood for himself and his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided his with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing his to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, a 30-year-old maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna State, has plans to improve his life by improving his farming operations.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his yields and move from a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He dreams of a profitable farming operation which will help him improve his standard of living.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving that dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing his to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en: Ishaku is a dedicated maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to bring positive change to his life and his family and this loan is helping him achieve that dream.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is a hard-working and responsible wife and mother to her three children. She is glad and grateful because, through her husband's moral support, she was able to maintain her business well. She manages a vegetable and corn farm production; she grows eggplant, string beans, green peppers and bitter gourds  She also operates a motorcycle transport business.

To keep her vegetables and corn farm productive, she is asking for additional capital of PHP12,000 which will  allow her to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide for the maintenance of her crops. She knows that through the application of the necessary fertilizers and pesticides to her vegetables, she will further ensure a good yield. 

She is hoping for the approval of her requested loan amount to generate better income, and for the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and pesticide for the maintenance of her crops.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Rita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running general store. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy a net and other equipment to use when fishing. Rita began growing her business with help from a previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Cecelia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her dried fish making business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to puchase additional fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 48, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is living with her partner, Sonny, who works as a seaman. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nida hopes that her business will be successful, and dreams that her family will always be in good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. Maricel is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells beauty products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional products for her business, which she has run for the last 10 years. Remedios earns additional income by selling vegetables. She has made good use of previous loans from NWTF to grow her business. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22  años de edad, es soltero,   vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz,  y cría  pollos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.
  
Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño s comprar un terreno. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He belongs to the "VRC San Antonio" communal bank, whose members were brought up and live in the Recinto Aquas Frias area. For the most part they are farmers or raise livestock. Carlos is a farmer. He grows corn and raises chickens. 

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer, manure and supplies. With the help of this loan he can buy fertilizer. He buys his supplies weekly in Ventanas. His dream is to own a piece of land.  His challenge are infestations. In his spare time he likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and supplies.

loans.name: Cordelia Bih

texts.en:
Cordelia Bih is married with five children. They live in a four-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon. Cordelia Bih has faced so many challenges in life. Among them are inadequate finances to manage her business, the death of her father, which led to her dropping out of school, and the death of her junior brother, who had been a shoulder to cry on whenever she had marital problems or her children were sick.

Cordelia Bih has taken loans and repaid them successfully four times. She says, with this new loan, she will expand her business by buying more second-hand dresses and shoes for her shop and cosmetics like body oil, body lotion, body spray and bathing soap and hair products like mesh, hair oil and hair treatments.

She holds a positive view that her business will succeed because she has been in it for a long period of time and has regular customers who buy from her shop. She also has a good business site, which attracts more customers, and she offers sales at discount prices, which makes many people prefer to buy from her. 

With this business activity, the community will buy at reduced prices, and her hair and body treatments will make these community members look fresh and young.

With the profits from her business, Cordelia Bih will support her husband in catering to their children’s basic needs, provide her family with three square meals and make provisions for the unknown. 

She prefers loans from Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment because of its low interest rates and convenience.

loans.use: To buy shoes, dresses and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 and lives in Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by providing transportation services in a vehicle that carries up to four passengers. The company she works for gives her a portion of the fares she earns. She supplements her income by running a direct-selling business. Most of her customers live nearby and she earns a minimum of PHP 1,800 every day. Corazon is requesting a loan for PHP 17, 000 to buy spare parts and accessories to maintain her vehicle. She dreams that her business will be successful, and meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A group is composed of 15 to 30 people who meet each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain and buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Beverly works hard to support her family. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by operating a general store. Beverly is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business, which she has successfully grown with help from two previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies for her business

loans.name: Angel Adrian

texts.es:
Ángel 27  años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene un   hijo,   vive con su esposa e hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz ,  y cría  pollos y chanchos. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  pasar en su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel is 27 years old. He is in a free-union relationship. He has a son, and he lives with his wife and his son in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Rios.

His communal bank is Ventanilla Rural Comunal San Antonio. Its members work in agriculture. They all live in the Aguas Frias precinct; they have practically grown up in this zone. The majority of them work in agriculture or raising livestock.

Ángel works in agriculture. He plants corn, and he raises chickens and pigs. He is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy these items.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas every week.

His dream is to advance in his work. His challenge is the pests. He likes to spend his free time at home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost

loans.name: Ma Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Ma Antonia de 52 años de edad es casada y curso la primaria hasta el segundo grado educación, es madre de 2 hijos y en el trabajo del campo solo ella en compañía de su esposo se involucran en las diferentes actividades como la limpieza, corte, abono, etc. Ella se dedica hace mucho tiempo a realizar dichas actividades y hace 7 años se dedica a la elaboración de viveros de café para sembrar. Como mujer emprendedora identificando las necesidades de la zona donde ella habita decidió abrir un negocio de pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación la cual es un medio más de ingresos para ella y su familia. Sus clientes tanto para la venta de café como en su negocio de pulpería son sus vecinos y personas que viven en las afueras de la zona. 

Doña Ma Antonia ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara urea, abono, fertilizantes entre otros ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar y proteger sus cosechas y hacerlas atractivas para sus clientes.

Sus planes son los de poder aumentar sus cosechas, su producción y generar mejores ingresos para ella y su familia ya que la actividad de la agricultura es su único medio de ingreso económico para suplir las necesidades básicas entre otras.
texts.en:
Ma Antonia is 52 years old, married and the mother of two children. She studied up to Grade Two in Primary School. She works in the fields along with her husband doing the various activities like cleaning, cutting, applying fertilizer etc. She has done this for many years and seven years ago started a coffee nursery to produce seedlings to plant.

And as  the enterprising woman she is, she studied the needs of her area and decided to open a small store in her house which added one more source of income for her family. Her customers, both for the store and her coffee are her neighbors and others who live further from her house.
 
Ma Antonia has requested a loan from COMIXMUL in order to buy urea, fertilizer, manure, etc. so she can protect her crops and assure that she has a good harvest that will satisfy her clients. Her plans are to increase the size of her harvests and her production and generate more revenue for her family as agriculture is the only means she has of supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and other things for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Al quedar soltera y con la gran responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos prosiguió los trabajos que realizaba en el campo cultivando cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su zona. Tambien se dedica al tejido de mantas. Es una labor que considera muy entretenida y a la vez rentable, aprendió esta actividad de su madre quien también realizaba el tejido de estos telares que tiene finalmente varios usos costumbristas como para el cargado de bebes en la espaldas y la protección del frio. Entre sus principales compradores están sus vecinos y pobladores del lugar que siguen fielmente las costumbres milenarias.
Desea también mejorar su vivienda y construirlo a base de material noble. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevo soles para la compra de lana , hilos  y agujas al por mayor para la elaboración de más mantas.
texts.en: Faustina is 38 years old. She is a single mother of four children, with whom she lives in her house, which is constructed from wood. On being left single and with the great responsibility of supporting her children, she continued with the work that she was doing in the countryside, growing organic cacao and  other profitable products of her region. She also weaves blankets. It is work that she considers very enjoyable and at the same time profitable. She learned this work from her mother, who also did the weaving of these fabrics, which eventually have a number of customary uses, such as carrying babies on backs and protection from cold. Among her principal customers are her neighbors and residents of her area, who loyally follow the age-old customs. She also wants to improve her house and build it from high-quality materials. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she will receive to continue forward. In addition, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. At this time, she wants to have 1500 PEN for the wholesale purchase of wool, thread, and needles to make more blankets.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, and needles wholesale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old and married with four children. Wilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Wilma has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

Wilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 47 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Nida has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Nida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Olibeth

texts.en:
Olibeth, 20 years of age, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with 1 child. She has owned and managed a vegetable vending business for almost 5 years. With this business she's earning a net income of Php 500 per week. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, she's requesting a loan amounting to Php 13,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplant, string beans, and squash. She's hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she will be able to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell such as eggplant, string beans, and squash

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна – предприниматель из Запорожья. Она торгует женскими сумками, клатчами и прочим на одном из крупнейших рынков города, где всегда много покупателей. 
Татьяне необходима сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы запустить и развивать новую третью точку. Татьяна планирует закупить женские сумки, дорожные сумки и рюкзаки для реализации в этой торговой точке. Татьяна постоянно стремится развивать свое дело, прикладывает все силы для этого. Не так давно она перенесла операцию и до сих пор проходит реабилитацию после этого. Но, тем не менее, она не отчаивается, не думает о слабостях, а стремиться двигаться дальше в жизни и бизнесе.
texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye.  She sells women's purses, clutches, and so forth at one of the city's main markets where there are always a lot of shoppers.  

Tatyana needs 15,000 hryven in order to open and develop a new, third outlet.  Tatyana plans to buy women's purses, travel bags, and backpacks for this outlet.  Tatyana is always striving with everything she has to develop her business.

It wasn't very long ago that she underwent an operation and she is still undergoing rehabilitation.  But nonetheless, she doesn't get discouraged or think about her weaknesses.  She keeps trying to move forward in business and in life.

loans.use: to stock a new vending outlet with merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda continua con su actividad económica que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, ella continua con la pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos a sus amigos y vecinos. 

Hilda agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar la mercadería necesitaba entonces no dudo en pedir un nuevo crédito por ese motivo ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para continuar comprando mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le sale a mas barato. 

Hilda nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”
texts.en:
Hilda continues with her business, which is selling basic products, such as, for example, rice, sugar, pasta, oil, bread, soft drinks, beer, and other items. She continues with the little store in her home, where she sells her products to her friends and neighbors.

Hilda is immensely grateful to all the investors who supported her with the last loan, since it went very well for her and she was able to buy the merchandise she needed. Thereupon she did not hesitate to ask for a new loan for this purpose. She now needs a loan to continue buying merchandise such as, for example, sacks of rice and sacks of sugar, wholesale, since she can get it more cheaply.

Hilda was born in the Challabamba district, and she lives in the same district where she was born. (The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru). She is 35 years old and is in a free union relationship from which she has four children. She belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca" (Virgin of Chanca).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar wholesale, since it is cheaper for her

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 40 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged between 22 and 10. She lives in rural Kwale, 50km south of Mombasa, Kenya.

Tabitha has been practicing farming for the last 15 years. She has not employed anyone on the farm and she does everything herself. She plants crops such as maize, beans, and tomatoes. In the next five years she wants to be growing and supplying all kinds of farm products to the nearest towns. The only challenge that she has to deal with is climate changes. 

She found out about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the farm. The extra income that she will raise from farming will help her pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru:
Наталья торгует одеждой на городском рынке. Наталья воспользовалась кредитом год назад для закупки школьной одежды. Она удачно вложила средства и получили дополнительную прибыль. 

В этом году фирма-поставщик предложила Наталье существенные скидки на закупку одежды. Сюда входит как одежда для школьников, так и прочая осенняя одежда (штаны, рубашки, блузки, пиджаки, пр.). Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки осенней одежды по выгодной цене. Кредит позволит ей получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить благосостояние своей семьи. Бизнес Натальи является единственным источником дохода для нее и ее сына.
texts.en:
Natalia sells clothes at the city market.  A year ago, she tool advantage of a loan to buy school clothes.  She was successful in how she invested the funds and earned an additional profit.

This year, a supplier offered Natalia deep discounts on clothing orders.  The discounts are on school clothes and other fall clothing such as heavy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets and so forth.  Natalia is asking for a loan so she can buy fall clothing at an advantageous price.  The loan will allow her to earn extra profit and to improve her and her son's well-being.  Natalia's business is their only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for the fall season

loans.name: Natividad Evelina

texts.es:
Natividad tiene  47  años de edad, es soltera, tiene tres  hijos,   vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Natividad se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz ,  y cría  pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío son las plagas.
En sus tiempos libres le gusta  pasar en su casa.
texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old. She is single and has three children. She lives with her children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

Her communal bank is Ventanilla Rural Comunal San Antonio. Its members work in agriculture. They all live in the Aguas Frias district. They have practically grown up in this zone. The majority of them work in agriculture or livestock raising.

Natividad works in agriculture. She plants corn and raises chickens. She is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy these items.

She makes her purchases in Ventanas every week. Her dream is to advance with her work. Her challenge is the pests.

She likes to spend her free time at home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost

loans.name: Dalila's Group

texts.fr:
Louise  fait partie du groupe Bora et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 39 ans et  marie à Denis, un garagiste. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 10 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, savon,..),   depuis 19 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, savon,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle, construire une maison et voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en: Louise is a member of the Bora group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 39-years-old and married to Denis, a mechanic. Together, they have three children between the ages of 10 and 18, all of whom are in school. She has run her shop (beans, rice, soap,..) for 19 years. She is on her sixth loan at Turame. With the KIVA credit that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of items for her shop to resell in order to make more money. In the coming years, she would like to buy a piece of land, build a house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of items for her shop (beans, rice, soap,...) to resell in order to make more money.

loans.name: Jose Abrahan

texts.es:
El señor José  de 60  años  de edad es soltero,  vive con su hijos en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de leche, cuajada y vacas.
Don José sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la zona y personas que se dedica al destazo, es una persona trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Don José está solicitando el préstamo para compra de una vaquilla, con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende incrementar su ganado para poder beneficiarse y seguir elaborando la leche y cuajada para la venta.
Don José su sueño es tener bastantes vacas que le puedan dar bastante leche, para logra de esta forma una mejor condición de vida y también desea realizarle mejoras en un futuro a su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old, single, and lives with his children in his one-room house. For the past 6 years, he has made a living selling milk, milk curd, and cows.
