His customers are friends, neighbors and butchers. He is a hard-working person with a desire to move forward. 

José is requesting the loan for the purchase of a cow. With the support of the loan, he hopes to increase his cattle in order to be able to profit and be able to continue making milk and milk curd to sell. 

His dream is to have enough cows that they can give enough milk, and in that way he can achieve a better condition in life. He also hopes to make improvements to his house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his business.

loans.name: Pedro Serverino

texts.es:
Pedro  tiene 43  años de edad, es viudo, tiene dos hijos,   vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 


La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz ,  y cría de pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   Su sueño es comprar  un terreno. 

Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta  jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old. He is a widower and has two children. He lives with his children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

His communal bank is Ventanilla Rural Comunal San Antonio. Its members work in agriculture. They all live in the Aguas Frias sector. They practically grew up in this zone. The majority of them work in agriculture or livestock raising.

Pedro works in agriculture. He plants corn and raises chickens.

He is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy these items.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas every week. His dream is to buy a plot of land.

His challenge is the pests. In his free time he likes to play baseball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies, and compost

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Santos de 58  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo que depende de él y de su esposa que también le ayuda en sus gastos,  vive en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras.
Don Santos se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de venta de de abarrotería como ser productos de la canasta familiar y sus clientes son los alumnos de la escuela aledaña, vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Don Santos  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio como pan, frescos, agua, azúcar, café, arroz, frijoles, etc. y además desea comprar insumos para hacer su milpa en la época de postrera.
Don Santos  con el  apoyo del préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener energía eléctrica en su casa y que le mejoren la carretera.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old. He has one child who is dependent on him and his wife, who also helps him with their expenses. He lives in a community in Choluteca in southern Honduras.

For 10 years, Santos has worked at his grocery store business selling basic staples. His customers are students from the nearby school, neighbors, and friends who visit him every day. 

Santos is requesting this loan in order to purchase products for his business, like bread, soft drinks, water, sugar, coffee, rice, beans, etc. In addition, he wants to buy supplies to plant his cornfield during the off-season. 

With the support from this loan, Santos hopes to improve his earnings and his quality of life. His dreams are to get electrical power in his house and that the road will be improved. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July of 2013.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, water, sugar, coffee, rice, beans, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Erika Jeanina

texts.es:
Erika tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo,  vive con su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Erika    se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz,  y cría de chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Erika is 25 years old, single, with a child. She lives with her child in the Province of Ventanas de Los Rios.
Their community bank is called VRC San Antonio. The members work in Agriculture. They all live in the Recinto Aguas Frias neighborhood. They all grew up in this area. They work in agriculture and also fishing. 
Erika is a farmer. She grows corn and rice and she raises pigs. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure. With the support of this loan, the group members will buy fertilizer at a low price in order to be efficient.
They buy their goods in Las Ventanas each week.
Her dream is to succeed with her work. Her fears are plant diseases. In her free time she likes to play sports

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and manure.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 31-year-old married woman  from San Miguel, Bohol and the mother of four children. She is engaged in retail sales of slippers, shoes, and other footwear materials. 

Joy is asking for a loan to buy more slippers and shoes and other footwear to sell. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock and attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Joy hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and shoes and other footwear to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy stock like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Gemma has been in this business for four years. Gemma earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock like canned goods, eggs, spices, soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y los hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Rafael, an enterprising man, is 36 years old. He is married and currently lives with his wife and his children. 

He is requesting a loan with the hopes of purchasing supplies like fertilizer and pesticides. He wants to “help out” the coffee crops, for the purpose of keeping them in good condition during their development in order to obtain a good quality product. 

The only limitation that this gentleman has is a lack of funds for continued growth, since they depend on this economic activity to get ahead. Therefore, he is making a request for a loan, and this is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He doesn’t take out other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Bella Vista 2 Group

texts.es:
Haydee, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo con quien vive en una comunidad que pertenece a Islas de la Bahía. Doña Haydee genera sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, hace dos años ofrece productos de cosméticos como cremas, lociones y maquillajes. Además tiene unos apartamentos que renta. Su objetivo para lo cual trabaja es para tener estabilidad económica y mejorar su condición de vida. 
En su comunidad tienen problemas de agua potable, para solventarlo ha decidido formar un grupo para solicitar financiamiento y poder perforar y habilitar un pozo de agua potable. El grupo esta formado de 12 miembros y tiene como nombre Bella Vista 2, quienes han solicitado 5,000 lempiras cada uno, haciendo un total grupal de 60,000 Lempiras. en la fotografía se identifican así: a la izquierda esta doña Haydee de blusa blanca y Jeans, sigue don José, luego Floridalma, Reynaldo, Edin, Maura, Julio, Delia, Elder, Amado, Nahúm y Juan a la derecha. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y realizan diversas actividades de negocios y algunos trabajan en empresas y atienden sus negocios.
texts.en:
Haydee, 40, is a single mother.  She lives with her son in a community in the Bahía Islands.

Haydee earns her own income to support her household.  For two years she has sold cosmetics such as creams, lotions, and make-up.  She also has some apartments that she rents.  The goal she works for is to have economic stability and improve her living conditions.

In her community they have problems with potable water.  To pay for it she decided to form a group to request financing to be able to drill and set up a well for drinking water.  The group is made up of 12 members and is called Bella Vista 2.  They've requested 5,000 lempiras [HNL] each, for a group total of 60,000 lempiras.

The people in the photograph are:  Haydee at the left, wearing a white blouse and jeans, then José, next Floridalma, Reynaldo, Edin, Maura, Julio, Delia, Elder, Amado, Nahúm, and Juan at the right.  They all live in the same community and have different businesses; some work for companies and take care of their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for drilling and setting up a well for drinking water

loans.name: Sandro Henrry

texts.es:
Sandro tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero,  vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Sandro   trabaja en su negocio de abarrotes, siembra de maíz ,  y cría de pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  

compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es agrandar su negocio. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sandro is 29 years old, single and he lives alone in the subdivision of Ventanas in the Los Rios province. The communal bank he belongs to is San Antonio and its members all work in agriculture. They all live in an area of the Aguas Frias sector and practically grew up in that area. Most of the members work in agriculture or with livestock.

Sandro works in his grocery store, he grows corn and raises chickens. He requests the loan in order to buy fertilizers, supplies and compost. With the support of the loan he'll be able to buy the fertilizers. He makes his purchases in Ventanas every week. His dream is to expand his business and his challenge is pests. During his free time he likes to take care of his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, supplies and compost.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of 10 children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 40 years now. She helps her husband in tilling the lands. 
Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm.
In the future, Lourdes hopes to make her farming business a success and to provide a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and married with two children.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, and canned goods.

Irene has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

Irene aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, and canned goods

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en: A hardworking man, Murodjon with his family lives in a house which is in bad condition. His wife is a hardworking woman who is busy with animal husbandry. They have three clever children aged 18, 14 and 4. Murodjon's children want to live in a house in good condition but his income from farming is not enough for it. He has 0.30 ha of land where he grows vegetables and crops. He must repair all rooms of his house. He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to repair his house. In this way he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. He awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing his house

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a widow with four children and they all live in a two bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenge in life among which are inadequate finance to manage her business, death of her family members, sickness in her family, her properties were seized by her late husband's family after his death, and other family issues.
She has taken and successfully repaid two loans and says that with this new loan she will buy materials for sewing of women’s underwear in her tailoring workshop and also buy firewood for sale in her compound. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for so long and as such has experience in the business, demand for firewood is high in her neighborhood, and she has many customers who give her orders for women's underwear at regular intervals. With this business, the community will have a regular supply of firewood and at low prices.
With the profit from this loan, she will expand her business by buying more materials for her tailoring workshop, pay her children's school fees, help the needy in her family and cater for her late brother’s children. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the members are trained on loan management before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials, and firewood

loans.name: Ivane

texts.en:
Ivane is 56 years old, widowed and lives with his retired mother in the Lagodekhi district. He has a vocational education in engineering and works in construction in his district. He renovates and paints houses in return for a service fee but the income from this activity is not stable and it depends on special orders.

Ivane is requesting a loan from Credo to re-start-up his family business which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to purchase pigs to start an animal husbandry business. He will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and raise and sell them for a higher price. Ivane's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for country vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Ivane's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a stitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. 

Zubaida, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profits he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Zubaida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 17 Septembre 2011 lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement est à son cinquième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit comme, accompagné d’activité de maraichage durant l’hivernage.

Madame Binta (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants : 04 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de thé, de sucre et autres produits alimentaires à savoir les biscuits et bonbons qu’elle achète en gros au marché régional.

 Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter trois boîtes de 10 paquets de thé, un sac de sucre et quels que sachets de biscuits et bonbons. 

Les bénéfices lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de scolarisation de ses enfants et ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been in existence since its inauguration on September 17, 2011.  It is on its fifth loan cycle and comprises women who all live in the same village.  They get along well with one another and are united by a good group's spirit.  They are essentially involved in small retail business as well as market gardening during the rainy season.

Binta (in the standing row, at the far right of the photo, and raising her hand), is the group's featured borrower.  She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of six children (four boys and two girls).  She is actively involved in the sale of tea, sugar and other food products such as cookies and candies, which she buys in bulk quantities at the regional market.

With her new loan, Binta will buy three boxes containing ten packets of tea each, one bag of sugar and a few bags of cookies and candies.

She will use her profits to take care of her children's educational needs as well as her own needs.

loans.use: to buy three boxes containing ten packets of tea each, one bag of sugar and a few bags of cookies and candies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 12 "pagnes", five dozen sweaters and three dozen chains and earrings.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 03enfants, Akossiwavi réside à Agoé lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente des petits poissons, de la tomate, du riz, huile végétale). Elle achète au Grand Marché. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son  cinquiéme crédit. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants vue qu’elle prend seule en charge ses derniers, avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits, et plus tard faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT. Âgée de 51ans, elle a une ancienneté de 18ans.
texts.en: The mother of three children, Akossiwavi resides in Agoé, where she runs her business (selling small fish, tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil). She makes her purchases at the Grand Market. She is a previous client of WAGES and she is on her fifth loan. She wants to ensure a brilliant future for her children, since she alone cares for them, has a boutique for selling her products, and will later have an import-export business. 51-years-old, she has 18 years of experience.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, tomatoes, and other items

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Farangis is 21 years old. She is young but she has a broken heart. Her beloved husband died, and she is now a widow. She does not have any children. She lives with parents who help her out a lot. She works as a cashier in a mobile company. Farangis has her own business selling Oriflame products. She is a hardworking and kind woman. She wants to buy a mobile phone and computer, but her salary is small and does not have enough money to buy a computer and mobile phone. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD. 

This is her second loan from IMON. She paid the previous loan on time. She awaits your support and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone and computer.

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Veronique est vice présidente du collectif  d’affaire  « Bora», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 52 ans, mère de 12 enfants dont certains étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers. Son conjoint est un chômeur, sans emploi depuis, plusieurs années. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle installe ses produits au marché et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Au fil des années,  elle tomba en faillite. Ainsi, vers les années 2007, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima pour redémarrer son activité.  Il y a environ 31 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 paniers de poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The customer, Véronique, is vice-president of the Bora business group. At 52, she is the eldest in the group and an experienced entrepreneur. She is mother to 12 children, some of whom are studying and others who already have their own households. Her husband is unemployed and has had no work for several years. Véronique sells fish and does this at the market and sometimes from home. She began her business with capital given to her by her husband. Over time she went bankrupt. As a result, around 2007 she got a loan from IMF Hekima so that she could restart her business. She has been doing this business for around 31 years now. This new loan will be used to buy four baskets of fish. She would thereby like to expand her business, educate and feed her children and also build a house. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for its support in the form of microfinance for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of fish.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Baraka Office Group

texts.fr: La cliente Media est membre du collectif  d’affaire  « baraka office»,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 44 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de braises. Elle installe ses produits dans un petit dépôt et parfois,  à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son familier (alors son grand frère), il y a environ 11 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 20 sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs, surtout aux veuves.
texts.en: The customer, Media, is a member of the Baraka Office business group. She is an experienced entrepreneur who is 44 years old, a widow and mother to five children, who are all studying. She sells charcoal and sells her products in a small store and sometimes from home. She began her business with capital given to her by her family (her elder brother in fact) around 11 years ago. This new loan will be used to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. She thereby wants to expand her business, educate and feed her children and also build a house. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for its support in the form of microfinance to small entrepreneurs, particularly to widows.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed items and products for her variety store. The income from her business assisted her children's education and their household expenditures. She has been in this business for three years now. Her husband helps her to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann dreams of becoming more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of tomatoes, bananas..to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI    est constitué de 10 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et.3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier HEREMAKONO NORD  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt  a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de médicaments traditionnels à travers ASSETOU, elle est la 1ère femme assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, une centaine de flacons de médicaments avec les fabricants de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of ten women, who are all married and average 36 years of age with three children each. They live in traditional enlarged families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the Heremakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni.

They got to know each other as neighbors, friends and through trading. In order to boost their financial capacity and improve their trading businesses, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid in full. 

This group of women trade in traditional medecines through Assetou, who is sitting on the far right of the photo. With her loan she is planning to buy a hundred bottles of medicine from manufacturers in Bougouni. She sells her products at the market and from home, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up principally of women. She is planning to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA, which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional medecines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic plates and cups.

loans.name: Chantheng's Group

texts.en:
Chantheng is married and a mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a resident of the Sa Ang district in the Kandal Province of Cambodia. 

Chantheng manages two hectares of farmland on which she grows rice as her family's primary source of income. She grows vegetables while her husband is a fisherman to earn extra money. She has been involved in her current business for 32 years, and she is able to earn about 26,400 KHR per day. 

Chantheng’s group comprises two female members. She is in her first loan cycle and her group member is in her fourth cycle. Now they are applying for the same amount of 185,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Chantheng will use her loan portion to buy a below-the-ground latrine for her family. She hopes that her family and children will be able to enjoy improved sanitation conditions.

loans.use: To buy a below-ground latrine.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem, age 43, is married with one son. She resides in a rural village in the Sa Ang district of the Kandal province. To support her family, she has been selling clothes for 23 years. She and her husband earn about KHR 100,000 per day and save about KHR 50,000 each day for their future needs. 

Saem has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan to better support her family. Now she is asking for a loan of 2,400,000 KHR to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is married with six children. They live in a five-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  

Justina has faced many challenges in life, such as inadequate finance to manage her business, death of family members, illness in the family and marital problems.

She has taken out and successfully repaid her loans from GHAPE eight times.  With this new loan, she will open a tailoring workshop in Bamenda town and will buy a sewing machine, an electric iron, scissors, tape, tables, chairs and cloth.  Justina holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has a good business site with ready customers who need her services.  Additionally, she has undergone training in one of the renewed tailoring workshops in town, so she is prepared to design good outfits that will attract customers.  She also expects to sew dresses for meeting members in her community at a discount, benefiting community members.

With the profit from this loan, she will support her husband in the education of their children by paying their fees, she will expand her business, take care of her family and also save to undertake bigger investments. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, iron, scissors, tape table and chair and materials

loans.name: Chamnab's Group

texts.en:
Chamnab, 33, is married with three children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province province’s Kam Rieng district. For the last seven years, she and her husband have been farming rice and cassava. The current business earns her about 39,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Chamnab has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member is just with VisionFund for this cycle. The past loan from VisionFund helped Chamnab better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chamnab will use her portion to buy seeds and plow her farmland.  She will also use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to plow her farmland

loans.name: Daniel David

texts.es:
David  tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero,  vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

David     se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz, cacao y cría de pollos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.  
  Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío son las plagas. En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
David is 33 years old, single, and lives on his own in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. He belongs to the VRC San Antonio group, whose members make a living in agriculture. They all live in the Aguas Frías district, which is where they grew up. Most of them work in agricultural or livestock activities.

David makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and cocoa, and breeding chickens. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, supplies and compost. With the help of the loan, he will buy the goods in cash in Ventanas each week.

His dream is to succeed with his work. His main challenge is pests. In his free time he enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies and compost.

loans.name: Juraqul

texts.ru: Чуракул 47-летний земледелец, проживающий в районе Дж.Руми. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Чуракул имеет 30 соток приусадебного участка земли. На этой земле он вместе с семьей занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Он хороший дехканин. Чуракул сейчас хотел бы начать овцеводческий бизнес. Он знает, что выращивание овец не трудоемкое дело и он мог бы совмещать его с земледельческой деятельностью. У Чуракула имеются сбережения, сарай для содержания скота и корм. Он просит кредит в размере 1500 долларов США, чтобы закупить 8 голов овец и открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже мелкого рогатого скота. В будущем за счет прибыли с деятельности он хочет провести ремонт в доме и создать хорошие условия для проживания семьи.
texts.en: Juraqul is a 47 year old farmer who lives in the region of J. Rumy. He is married and has three children. Juraqul has 30 acres of infield land. Together with his family he cultivates agriculture crops. He is a good farmer. Now Juraqul wants to start a sheep keeping business. He knows that growing sheep is not very labor intensive and he can combine it with his agriculture business. Juraqul has savings, a shed to keep the cattle and fodder. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 USD to buy eight heads of sheep and open a business in feeding and selling small horned cattle. In the future he wants to make repairs at home and improve living conditions for his family using the profit from the loan.

loans.use: to buy eight heads of small horned cattle to open a cattle feeding and reselling business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 29 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Se dedica principalmente a la agricultura hace 7 años en un terreno de una hectárea y media que su padre le heredó y donde posee actualmente muchas plantaciones de cacao.Pero tambien cuenta con un vehículo de segunda mano con el cual brinda el servicio de taxi, realiza está actividad para obtener otra fuente de ingresos incursionando en el servicio de transporte por las zonas rurales de su localidad. Esta labor es agotadora ya que debe madrugar para transportar a los pobladores hasta la capital de su distrito para realizar gestiones de rutina y eso le genera muchas ganancias a largo plazo, no obstante las únicas vías de acceso que existen no son asfaltadas afectando periódicamente la integridad del vehículo. En mas de una ocasión también le es útil para transportarse hasta sus parcelas ya que están algo lejanas de su localidad. Uno de sus principales objetivos es trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para obtener más ingresos a futuro y poner una tienda de productos comestibles en el primer piso de su vivienda. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para brindarle un mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte con la compra de repuestos.
texts.en:
Julia is 29 years old, married, and has three children with whom she lives in an adobe house. For the past seven years, her main source of income has been agriculture. She farms a one and a half hectare plot of land she inherited from her father and which currently contains many cocoa plantations. She also has a second-hand vehicle with which she provides a taxi service, to make extra money transporting people around the rural areas where she lives. This is an exhausting job, because she has to get up very early to drive people to the capital of the district for their routine business, but it is very profitable in the long term. However, the only access roads are not tarmacked, which causes regular damage to her vehicle. On more than one occasion, the vehicle has been useful for her to get to her land, since they are quite far from her home.

One of her main aims is to work with her usual motivation to increase her earnings in the future and set up a food store on the first floor of her home. This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving to move forwards. She is committed to making her loan repayments on time. On this occasion, she would like 1,000 soles to buy spare parts for her vehicle, to keep it in good condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to keep her vehicle well-maintained.

loans.name: Bilakoro Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BILAKORO   est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  NIEBALA  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  produits cosmétiques à travers de SOUADOU ,elle est la1ére femme assise de la gauche vers la droite . Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 cartons de produits constitués de pommades, crèmes, lotions, vernis, déodorants et parfums auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Bilakoro group is made up of 7 women who are all married and have an average age of 45 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Niebala district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly relationships, friendships and business. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business and are on their third loan. The previous two loans have been properly repaid. 

The women of the group sell beauty products via Souadou. She is the woman sitting on the left in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 15 boxes of beauty products containing pomades, creams, lotions, varnish, deodorants and perfumes from the local wholesalers. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash or credit to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs to her vehicles.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a hardworking woman. She is married and has no children. She works at the fire station. She likes her job, as she knows that she always helps people. She has a small salary. Every month she has had 500 TJS. Her husband has been busy with a small business. Mavjuda got married one year ago. She and her husband have a new household. Now, she is going to buy upholstered furniture. 
This is her first loan from KIVA and its field partner IMON. She is asking for a loan of 2500 TJS. She awaits your support. She has great plans for the future.

loans.use: to buy upholstered furniture for her household.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DJIGUISSEME  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt  a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers à travers de HAMA qui est la 1ére femme debout de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des articles divers: savons, habits pour enfants et sounbala  avec les commerçants grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of 4 women who are all married and have an average age of 39 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly relationships, friendships and business. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they could better do business and are on their second loan. The previous loan was properly repaid.

The women of the group sell various items via Hama who is standing on the right of the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy various items (soaps, children's clothing and sumbala, a condiment made from nére seeds) from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and door-to-door for cash or credit to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs which she will reinvest in her business and use to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy items like soaps, children's clothing and sumbala.

loans.name: Irlanda Otilia

texts.es:
Irlanda tiene 42  años de edad, es soltera,  tiene cuatro hijos,  vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.

Irlanda    se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz, cacao y cría de pollos y chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.
  
Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.   

Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío es la competencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Irlanda is 42 years old, single, and has four children. She lives with them in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. Irlanda belongs to the VRC San Antonio community bank, whose members make a living in agriculture. They all live in the Aguas Frías district, where they grew up. They mainly work in agriculture and livestock farming. 

Irlanda makes a living in agriculture, growing corn, rice and cocoa, and rearing chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer, supplies and compost, and will make her purchases in Ventanas each week.  

Her dream is to move forwards with her work. Her main challenge is the competition. In her free time she likes to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supplies and compost.

loans.name: Bunthoern

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village in Battambang Province’s Phnom Proek District, Bunthoern is 39 years old. He is married and has two children. For the last 10 years, he has been farming corn on four hectares of farmland to support his family. With the current business, he can earn about 48,000 KHR per day and can save about 25,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Bunthoern is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farmland. He hopes to grow his corn fruitfully, so as to sell it for a good price to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farmland.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn buys and sells vegetables in her local community to help her husband generate income. With her husband, she works hard to upgrade their quality of life to give their children a better future. In this regard, she plans to continue and to improve her business to increase sales.

Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy various fruits and vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, malunggay, string beans, squash, beans, onions, and garlic to sell. She believes that when her loan request is granted, she will be able to acquire more kinds of fruits and vegetables to sell for greater profits.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables such as eggplant, tomatoes, malunggay, string beans, squash, beans, onions, and garlic to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, 26 years of age, is married and they have been blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store for almost 6 years. She's earning a net income of Php 200 per day. Due to lack of capital she has requested a loan amounting to Php 14,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, bread, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, condiments, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business in order to earn more income and to have a profitable business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, bread, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, condiments, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Elba Jenny

texts.es:
Elba tiene  40   años de edad, es soltera,  tiene cuatro hijos,  vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 


La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC San Antonio sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del Recinto Aguas Frías prácticamente se han Criado en esa zona. Se dedican a labores agrícolas o pecuarias en su mayoría.


Elba    se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz, cacaoy cria de pollos y chanchos. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos.
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes.  
Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas  cada semana.  
Su sueño es salir adelante con su trabajo. Su desafío es la competencia. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Elba, 40, is single and has four children.  She lives with them in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the communal bank "San Antonio" work in agriculture and all live in the community of Aguas Frías, where they were practically raised.  Most of them are crop or livestock farmers.

Elba works in agriculture and grows corn, rice and cocoa and also raises chickens and pigs.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and supplies.  She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers.  Every week she goes to Ventanas to make her purchases.  Her goal is to get ahead in her work, despite the competition she faces.

In her free time she enjoys staying busy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Eduarda Ilaria

texts.es:
Eduarda continua con el negocio de venta de comestibles y participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”. 

Eduarda agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar la mercadería necesitaba entonces no dudo en pedir un nuevo crédito por ese motivo ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para continuar comprando mercadería como por ejemplo  sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, detergentes y otras cosas. 

Eduarda vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Eduarda still has her business selling foodstuffs and is still a member of the “Virgen de Chanca” community bank. 

She is extremely grateful to all the lenders who supported her through her last loan, which was a real success and allowed her to buy the merchandise she needed. Therefore, she didn't think twice about requesting a new loan. On this occasion, she needs the money to buy goods such as bags of rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, biscuits, detergents and other items.

Eduarda lives in the city of Challabamba, which is located in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, biscuits, detergents and other items.

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
Artashes is from Armavir town where he lives with his wife, mother-in-law, and three children. He earns his family's living by providing electrician services to locals from the small cellar he rents near his house. 

Artashes requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Artashes has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Thus, this loan is very important for Artashes to purchase a generator and a piece of equipment specialized for his work so as to be able to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a piece of equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.
Virgenia requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.
Virgenia has been in this business for years now.
In the future, Virgenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 16 años. Debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo y por la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia, ella decidió buscar opciones para generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por lo que hace un año y medio inició con su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en la casa donde reside, allí ofrece productos de la canasta familiar como galletería, huevos, café, azúcar, pan, entre otros; actividad con la cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.  El negocio cuenta con la ventaja de estar muy bien ubicado pues se encuentra en una zona residencial donde es muy común comprar los productos para consumo diario. Ana solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (café, pastas, granos, azúcar, salsas, galletería, productos de aseo personal, entre otros) y realizar mejoras locativas (pintar el local y acondicionar la red eléctrica), con lo que podrá mejorar la apariencia del negocio y ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de los ingresos por ventas. Ana sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, tenerlo bien surtido y en un mediano plazo poder convertirlo en un supermercado reconocido en el sector, esto le ayudará a tener una estabilidad económica favorable para mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 10 and 16.  Due to a lack of employment opportunities and the difficult economic situation the family was in, she decided to look for ways to generate her own income.  A year and a half ago she started her own business and set up a store at home.  She sells family basket items such as cookies, eggs, coffee, sugar, bread, etc.  The work has given her enough money to support her husband in taking care of household expenses.

The advantage of the business is that the store is located in a residential area where the purchase of daily consumption items is very common.  Ana is requesting a loan to buy a variety of wholesale products (coffee, pasta, grains, sugar, sauces, cookies, personal care and others).  She also wants to renovate the store (painting and electrical wiring) to give it a better appearance and offer more product variety to satisfy customer preference and needs.  This will help increase sales income.  

Ana wants to grow her business and keep it well-stocked so that in the medium term she can turn it into a well-known supermarket.  This will give her more economic stability to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of wholesale products (coffee, pasta, grains, sugar, sauces, cookies, personal care, etc.) and carry out improvements at her store.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim, a villager from Kandal province, is 53 years old and married. She has six children, two of whom are still in school and dependent upon her. Her main source of income is from a rice growing business, as well as from her husband who is a fisherman in the local area. She has been involved in her current business for 33 years.
Kim has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles and has fully repaid her prior loans with success. The past loans have enabled her to improve her living condition by purchasing decent food and clothing, and allowed her to keep her children in school. 
For this cycle, she joins a group of three with the same loan amount request. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a below the ground latrine for her family, which will improve sanitation for her children and help to prevent any diseases caused by poor sanitation.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 37-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband owns a clothing shop in the market. He purchases a variety of unstitched clothes, stitches them, and sells them in the main market. Currently, he needs funds to purchase clothing to continue his work. However, he does not have enough savings to purchase material for his business, and, because of this, he remains worried.

Najma does not like to see her husband worried, and she wants to help him. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. This loan will not only help him to continue his business, but it will also help him to increase his net income and savings as well. With the help of profits, Najma will purchase a washing machine for her personal use. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Adolfo

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45   años de edad, es casado,  vive con su esposa e en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Miguel   se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y con descuento.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en  Ventanas y Ricaurte cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos. 
 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Miguel, 45, is married and lives with his wife in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  The communal bank "Palmasola" is located in the residential area of Palmasola which belongs to the Ricaurte Parish, in the Urdaneta Canton.  The people here work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Miguel is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers which he will pay for in cash in order to get a discount.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and Ricaurte every week.

His dream is to buy land.  The challenge he faces is climate change.  In his free time he enjoys staying busy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Thavry's Group

texts.en:
A 24-year-old mother of one son, Thavry resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been farming rice while her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Together, they can earn about 27,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day from their current businesses, and can save about 4,000 KHR each day for future needs.  
This is the first loan for Thavry’s group with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes for this loan to increase her family’s business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Janeth Geoconda

texts.es:
Geoconda tiene 33   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene dos  hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Geoconda   se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantesa menor preciopor ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaurte cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos. 
 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en casa y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Geoconda, 33, lives with her common-law husband and two children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of the Los Ríos.

The communal  bank "Palmasola" is located in the residential area of Palmasola which belongs to the Ricaurte Parish in the Urdaneta Canton.  Agriculture and livestock farming are the main activities here.  

Geoconda is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers which will be less expensive because she will pay in cash.  Every week she makes her purchases in Ricaurte.

Her goal is buy land.  The challenge she faces is climate change.  In her free time she enjoys staying home and watching television.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Porfidio

texts.es: Porfidio  tiene la edad de 62 años, es divorsiado y vive con una hija . El el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el y a su hija  a salir adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Porfidio, 62 years old, is divorced and lives with his daughter. He wants a loan in order to buy livestock and sell it at a profit when it reaches adulthood. This business will help him and his daughter get by. He hopes to grow and achieve his goals thanks to this project, and wants to be able, in the future, to make a better life for himself and his family, and to have financial stability. This is Porfidio's first loan with field partner FUDECOSUR. He never took out a loan with a state bank, because FUDECOSUR offers easier conditions and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Ngum

texts.en:
Ngum is single with two children; she lives with her children in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  

Ngum has faced so many challenges, among them inadequate financing to manage her business, illnesses in her family that led to a reduction in capital for medication, bad debt by customers, the challenge of being a single mother with inadequate financing for her children's education, and other family problems.

She has taken out and repaid her loans twice, and says with this requested new loan, she will expand her restaurant business by buying more maize, palm oil, beans, and fire wood. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has a good business site, and she has experience in the business. With this activity, the community will buy food from her at low prices, and her neighbors will buy wood from her without tracking for long distances in search of wood.

With the profit from this loan, Ngum will expand her business, pay her children's school fees, provide balance to her children, and also buy farm seedlings for her farm. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low internet rates, convenient repayment terms, and the members are being trained prior to the loans being disbursed.

loans.use: To buy fire wood, maize, palm oil, and beans

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 45 years old, is from the far village of Union province of Isabela. She is a very hardworking woman, married with six children. 

She is asking a loan of Php 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock business so she can help her husband earn additional income.  She can then help sustain the needs of her family that she loves very much. 

In her free time, she always looking for a way to have their family bond. She wishes someday that she could expand her business and try to attain the quality of life that she is dreaming of.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old married woman residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district, Lay has three children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for five years, she can earn about KHR 29,000 per day to make a living, and can save about KHR 9,000 each day for future needs. 

Lay has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the previous loans. She successfully used the past loans to better her living conditions. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Lay, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 53 years old. He lives in Sagarejo, with his retired mother, grown daughter and son. His children are unemployed at the moment and his spouse works abroad to financially help her family. 

Vasil is involved in a trading business and sells household items from a stall located at the open market. The income from this activity is hardly enough to cover only food and everyday expenses for four people. Because the income is not enough for the family, Vasil decided to start a new business with the requested loan. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to vulnerable poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Vasil will start a bakery. He will renovate commercial space and purchase all the needed equipment for baking. Vasil will sell bread, pies and various baked dishes and the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a bakery.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, 36, is married to Cecilia, and they have three children aged 5, 8, and 12. 

He is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for his fifth loan from KADET ltd to enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer during this planting season. He paid his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profits, he hopes to pay school fees for his children.

In the near future, Andrew hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET ltd to enable him to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Phalsoern

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Phalsoern, 39, has three children in total. Phalsoern and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 20 years to make a living. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 20,000 KHR each day after her daily expenses. 

Phalsoern is now applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthier rice in greater quantities to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jettote

texts.en:
Jettote is married and has six children. They live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in life such as inadequate finance to properly manage her business, the death of her twin sister and other close relatives, loss of her animals due to theft, and sickness in her family.

She has taken and successfully repaid loans from GHAPE twice and says with this new loan requested, she will buy more piglets for her piggery, expand her tailoring workshop by buying more materials, engage in farming and rearing of chicks and buy feed for the chicks and piglets. She strongly believes that her business will succeed because she has been doing the businesses for some time now and has experience of properly managing the business. Though she had a slowdown due to inadequate finance, the demand for chicks and piglets is very high in her community, and she has a good site for keeping the animals. With these business activities, the community will have a supply of her commodities at low prices and the droppings from the pigs and chicks will serve as manure for her neighbors.

With the profit from this loan, she will support her husband in the education of their children by paying their school fees, provide her family with a balanced diet, expand her business and take care of other family needs. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the fact that the members are trained on loan management before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy piglets and expand her farming and her tailoring businesses.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   LAIDOU   est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de.28. ans et.3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de condiments  ADIARA,elle est la 2éme femme debout dans la photos de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40Kg de sel wassa et 2cartons de cube Maggi avec les commerçants grossistes de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The LAIDOU group consists of four married women who average 28 years of age and three children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the district of HEREMAKONO NORD, in the city of Bougouni. They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through their commercial activities. 

To strengthen their working capital and better conduct their business activities, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and this is their first loan cycle. They sell condiments. 

ADIARA, standing second from the left, plans to use her loan to buy 40 kg of salt and 2 cartons of Maggi bouillon cubes from wholesalers in BOUGOUNI. She sells at retail from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wool for weaving and spinning.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita, 58, is married and has four children. She manages a store while her spouse manages their farming business. Together, they earn profits just enough for their family's sustenance. Tita wants to improve her profits from the store, so she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy sardines, eggs, bread, biscuits and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to keep improving her small business to continue rendering good service and sales. The added product offerings acquired using the loan will encourage more customers to buy merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, bread, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 70 years old and married to Joyce; they are not supporting any children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 30 years and has applied for his sixth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals during this planting season. He paid his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to expand his farming business and make some savings.

David hopes to grow his farming business to make more income, which will enable him to make some savings.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 43 years old and married to Esther. They have two children, aged 12 and 1 year old. 

He is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor during this planting season. He paid his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to expand his farming business and make some savings.

In the near future, Benard hopes to expand his snow-peas business, as it is very profitable.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Heam is 52 years old and married. She has three children. 

To make a living, she has been raising four pigs and producing fishing instruments for selling. Having been in this business for 15 years, she is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Heam has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feeds for nourishing them and use a portion of it to buy materials for making fishing instruments. She also hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and materials to make fishing equipment for sale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong, age 61, lives in a rural village of the Moungkol Borey district and has four children. 

She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on one hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 21 years. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the microloan for Hong’s group of two members who are both female. She is a third-cycle client while the other is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. The past two loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve financial burdens and improve her livelihood. Now Hong, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her harvest so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Ramatu from Tombo Western Rural Area, near Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages 8 and 21 years.  

Ramatu runs a local fast food business at home; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Ramatu says that sometimes purchasing power is very slow. 

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like bulgur, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like bulgur, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
Saroen, 36, lives with his wife and two children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice and growing cassava and rubber for six years. The current business earns his family about 60,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saroen just started with VisionFund this loan cycle. Now, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to increase his family’s income so as to make living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 45   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene un hijo, vive con su esposo e hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Vilma  se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz.
 
Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado. 

 Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaurte cada semana.   Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  
En sus tiempos libres le gusta cuidar loa animales y ver las noticias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage and she has one child.  She lives with her husband and child in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  The communal bank “Palmasola” is located in the area of Palmasola which belongs to the Ricaurte parish in the Urdaneta canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Vilma works in agriculture planting corn and rice.  She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers.  With the support of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers at a lower price for being in cash.  She carries out her purchases in Ricuarte every week.

Her dream is to buy a field.  Her challenge is climate change.

In her free time she likes to take care of the animals and watch the news.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.ru:
Магдалина зарабатывает на жизнь тем, что ездит по школам и детским садикам, проводя выступления, сценки и концерты для детей. Работает сама, иногда помогает сестра. Магдалина – очень талантливая, она сама пишет стихи и песни, сама сочиняет сценарии своих выступлений. Более того, у нее есть свои авторские книги. Труднее всего Магдалине было начинать. Но благодаря своей настойчивости она смогла разрекламировать себя. 
В этот раз Магдалине понадобилась сумма в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести музыкальные инструменты, а именно, сопилки, гусли, маракасы и прочее, а также игрушки для детей. Для проведения концертов необходимо больше материалов и инструментов, ведь чем разнообразнее будет концерт, тем чаще Магдалина будет получать заказы в будущем. Со временем она надеется организовать выезды и заграницу. Полученную от выступлений прибыль Магдалина уже давно мечтает вложить в запись дисков со своими песнями, о чем мечтает уже несколько лет.
texts.en: Magdalena earns a living by traveling to schools and childcare centers putting on performances, short plays, and concerts for children.
