She works by herself, but sometimes her sister helps her out. Magdalena is very talented. She writes poems and songs, and composes scripts for her performances. She is also a book author. It was difficult for Magdalena to get started. But thanks to her resilience she was able to promote herself. Magdalena has saved 5000 hriven to buy musical instruments (traditional Ukrainian flutes, psalteries, maracas, etc.), and children's toys. To perform her concerts she needs more materials and instruments; the more varied the concerts, the more often she will be invited to perform. WIth time, she hopes to perform abroad. Magdalena has long dreamed of investing her earnings into recording CDs with her songs; this is something she has wanted to do for several years.

loans.use: to purchase musical instruments and toys for her shows

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Since 2005, he has been rendering taxi service to local people for living. His wife runs a cafeteria near his home and pays monthly rent to a landlord. Two of his children go to high school and one stays at home and helps her mother. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials in order to build a new house on the plot of land. Why he needs a new house is that during winter time, a Mongolian traditional ger can't protect his children from cold and as a result, his children got sick frequently last winter. 

He has built a house foundation and done some other construction work, and if now he can buy necessary materials, he could finish his new house before winter, which will come to Mongolia in three months. He wants to welcome the new year with his family in a new comfortable and warm house full of joy and happiness. 

More importantly, the new house will stop losing its heat and preserve energy and enable the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking and caring person. 

In the profile picture, you can see the borrower's tarnished and deteriorated portable felt dwelling.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials in order to continue building a house.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – из Виноградово. Она торгует в основном женской одеждой. Однако перед началом учебного года в Украине торгует также школьными сумками, канцелярскими товарами и прочими школьными принадлежностями. Светлана работает сама, без наемных рабочих. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Светлана любит заниматься выращиванием цветов, это помогает ей расслабляться и отдыхать. Особенно после стресса, который она пережила после недавнего развода с мужем.
Сумма в 5000 гривен ей необходима для того, чтобы закупить канцелярские товары, рюкзаки и сумки для реализации перед 1 сентября, когда дети идут в школу и студенты в университеты. Полученную прибыль Светлана планирует вложить в развитие своего бизнеса, а именно в приобретении партии одежды для торговли осенью и зимой.
texts.en:
Svetlana is from Vinogradov. She mostly sells women's clothing. But just before the new school year begins, she also sells school bags, office supplies, and various school supplies. Svetlana works by herself, without any hired help. She has been working in this business for 10 years. She loves to grow flowers; it helps her to relax and rest, especially after the period of stress when she was recently going through a divorce.

She needs 5000 hriven to buy office supplies, backpacks, and bags to sell before September 1, when the schools and university begin classes. Svetlana plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into expanding her business, especially buying batches of clothing for sale in the autumn and winter.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies and school bags

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
A woman who some years ago lost her beloved husband needs financial support. Her name is Nargiza. She is 33 years old. She has three children and she is the main support for the family. She lives in a village. 

She has been busy with sewing more than 16 years. She knows her business very well and has great experience. Since her husband died she has been managing the business alone. She sews dresses for local women. She has her own customers.  

She must to buy school uniforms for her children as all of her children go to school. She has not money for it, so she is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy school uniforms for her children. 

She has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, 36 years of age, is married and blessed with five children. 

She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 500 per day. 

Due to inadequate capital, she decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, condiments, biscuits, breads, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, condiments, biscuits, breads, and beverages.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is supporting her husband in earning income to sustain the needs of her family, especially their children, through the vending of fruits and vegetables. She is 41 years old and has four school-age children. 

She aims to improve her business and make it profitable in order to generate greater sales. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more food products to sell like tomatoes, beans, onions, eggplants, string beans, cabbages, potatoes and bananas. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be helpful to generate a greater source of income that she dedicates to her family.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell like tomatoes, beans, onions, eggplants, string beans, cabbages, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and married with one child who is in school. Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Margie has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maffenda

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Maffenda from Tombo in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children between the ages 4 years and 15 years.  

Maffenda runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Maffenda says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes sales are very slow. 

Maffenda has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her children's welfare and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 49 years old and has five children. Rosemarie is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Rosemarie has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Maxima Graciela

texts.es:
Máxima tiene 43   años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo, vive con su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Máxima se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaurte cada semana.   Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta criar pollos.
texts.en:
Máxima is 43 years of age, is single, and has a son. She lives with her son in the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Ríos Province. 

The description of the Palmasola communal bank is as follows: It is located in Palmasola, in Ricaurte parish, in Urdaneta Canton. Its members are farmers and livestock breeders. 

Máxima is a farmer who cultivates corn and rice. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizer. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy fertilizer at a lower price because she will be paying cash. She makes her purchases in Ricaurte every week. 

Her dream is to buy a plot of land. 

A challenge that she faces is the weather. 

In her spare time she likes to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like bananas, oranges, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 43 years old, living with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. 

Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice on an eight-hectare area of farmland for about 23 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 25,000 KHR but she is able to save 18,000 KHR each day.
 
This is the fourth loan for Chanthy with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to reap a better harvest from her rice paddy so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, tiene 53 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, no tiene ninguna relación sentimental desde hace muchos años ya que se ha dedicado siempre a velar por el cuidado de sus 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Siempre va en busca de nuevas oportunidades y ha aprendido a ser más fuerte con el paso de los años. Nancy es una mujer que disfruta del trabajo, no le gusta estar inactiva es por eso que no desmaya cuanto de realizar alguna labor se trata. Su fuente de ingreso principal consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, tiene 3 vehículos de los cuales uno presenta condiciones óptimas, otro que requiere algunos arreglos y un tercer vehículo que desde hace 5 años necesita una refacción completa para ponerlo en circulación. Se inició en este negocio hace 8 años y sus ingresos diarios se han incrementado. Además tiene una tienda de productos comestibles en donde trabaja con ayuda de su hija.
Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar el tercer vehículo que por ahora tiene en estado de inactividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas, motor y pagará la mano de obra del mecánico que reparará su mototaxi inactivo.
texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old.  She is an enterprising and very hardworking woman.  She hasn’t been in a romantic relationship for many years since she has always dedicated herself to looking to the care of her 4 children with whom she lives in her own house.  She always goes looking for new opportunities and has learned to be stronger with the passing of the years.  Nancy is a woman who enjoys work.  She doesn’t like to be inactive and it is for that reason that she doesn’t falter when there is a task to be done.  

The source of her main income consists of renting motorcycle taxis.  She has 3 vehicles of which one presents in optimal conditions, another that requires some repairs and a third vehicle that for five years has needed a complete refurbishment in order to put it into circulation.  She started in this business 8 years ago and her daily income has increased.  She also has a store of food products where she works with the help of her daughter. 

She likes all of the things she does a lot and doesn’t hesitate to put forward her best efforts to work each day with a lot of optimism.  Her great desire now is to repair the third vehicle that for now is in an inactive state.  On this occasion she requests 1,800 soles (PEN).  She is grateful and happy to know that she continues to have the financial support that she needs to advance with the progress of her business. 

She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of tires and an engine and she will pay for the labor of the mechanic that will repair her inactive motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy tires and an engine and to pay the mechanic who will work on the vehicle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married and has seven children, five of whom go to school. She lives in the Philippines and is in the agricultural business of fattening pigs. Elizabeth has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been fattening pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gal-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Gal-Erdene, 43 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He began building a house in 2012 and, in autumn, his family moved into the house. Using his previous loan, he managed to purchase and install double-glazed windows into house, thus reducing heat loss through its windows. 

His main family income comes from a taxi service he provides, using his automobile, and a salary his wife receives by teaching at kindergarten. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of  MNT 3,500,000 to purchase fiberglass, cement, foam, and hardwood flooring. Using those items, he wants to insulate his house in order to make his house a more comfortable and warm place. 

In three months, the winter will come and it is known for its harsh and chilling character. His disabled son should maintain his health by living in a warmer place and getting one flu is critical for his life. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future, for the sake of his children and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase fiberglass, cement, foam, and hardwood flooring.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira is 42 years old and is married with five children. She and her husband have been busy with farming and animal husbandry for more than 15 years and they live happily in a village. Mohira does not have a high degree and that’s why she always wanted to give her children an education. Her elder son graduated school this year and entered university. In the future, he will study electric utilities. Mohira's son is a smart and clever boy who has passed his exams successfully. 

Mohira is requesting a loan to pay for her son's education at the university. She must pay for his tuition but she does not have money. Mohira awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 65 years old married to Priscillah. They have four children and he is supporting his 12 and 16 year old.  Patrick is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru.

Patrick is requesting his seventh loan from KADET LTD to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. He hopes to use the profit from his loan to expand his farming business and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, and seasonings

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with two children. For the past two years, Diana has owned and managed a retail store. She earns a net income of 300 PHP each day.

Diana is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to purchase coffee, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, canned goods, and beverages. She's hoping that her business will become more progressive so that she can able to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Maseray is 29 years old and married with two children; one is aged twelve years old and goes to school, while the other is only one. Maseray runs a business selling home products in Tombo, in the Western rural area of Sierra Leone. She's been in this business since 2008 and sells sets of rubber bowls, pans and plates to her community. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of a proper location.

Maseray has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more plates and varieties of food containers to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and change her living status. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plates and varieties of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 15 and 27. Two of her children are going to school. Kadie runs a domestic product business in Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started her business because she wanted to take good care of her family. Kadie was in this business during the rebel war and she sells a variety of food containers within her community.  Her major business challenge is her improper business location.

Kadie is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more plates, bowls, and a variety of food containers to sell. She says that the extra income from her loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kadie would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plates, bowls, and a variety of food containers to sell

loans.name: Diana Rosa

texts.es: Diana tiene treinta y nueve años (39) de edad, reside en Salgar, corregimiento perteneciente al municipio de Puerto Colombia, departamento del Atlántico. Esta es una población a orillas del mar caribe, sitio turístico de la región costa caribe. Diana vive con su conyugue, con quien tiene tres hijas en edades de doce (12), diecisiete (17) y dieciocho (18) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio consiste en una miscelánea donde se expenden mercancías varias para niños, jóvenes y adultos, como ropa, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios y repuestos de bicicletas. Desde hace tres (3) años inició esta actividad, primero vendiendo solo repuestos y accesorios para motos, atendiendo una sugerencia de su marido,  y luego le agregó los demás productos que comercializa en su miscelánea. Compra de contado en distribuidoras mayoristas de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Abre su negocio todos los días, atiendiendolo de ocho (8) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche, vendiendo de contado y a crédito. Sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, y transeúntes. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de ropa, cosméticos, artículos de papelería, detalles, accesorios y repuestos para motos. Con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas, utilidades, y ahorrar. Sus metas a mediano plazo es la de ampliar la miscelánea, y terminar de remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Diana, 39, lives in the Salgar neighborhood of Puerto Colombia in the department of Atlántico, which is a tourist destination on the Caribbean coast. Diana lives with her husband, with whom she has three daughters, ages 12, 17, and 18. She owns a variety store, where she sells bicycle parts and clothing, cosmetics, lotions, and accessories for children and adults. She started the business three years ago, selling just bicycle accessories and spare parts at her husband's suggestion, and later she added more merchandise. 

Diana buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Barranquilla for cash. Her business is open every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m., and she accepts cash and offers credit. Her clients are neighbors, friends, and passers-by. This is her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, stationery, accessories, and bicycle parts. She expects to increase her sales, profits, and savings with this investment. Her near-term goals are to expand her store and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, stationery, accessories, and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn would like to keep achieving good profits and develop good growth and nutrition of her raised livestock for further improvement of her business income.

She is 52 years old and lives at Enrile with her family. She raises hogs for added income to sustain her family, especially their immediate daily needs. She has been in the business for three years now and earn approximately 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) for each hog when sold.

She is now asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs

loans.name: Julio Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 77   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Nelson se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes al contado y con descuento.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaurte cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta leer el periódico y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Nelson, 77, lives in a free union with his wife in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He belongs to the communal bank Palmasola, located in Palmasola in the Ricaurte parish of Urdaneta canton. The members are farmers and fishermen.

Nelson grows corn and rice. He has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer at a discount for cash. He makes his purchases in Ricaurte weekly. He dreams of buying land, and weather is his main challenge. He likes to read the newspaper and watch TV in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Octavio Edmundo

texts.es: Don Octavio es originario de la ciudad de Esteli. Se dedica a reparar refrigeradoras, lo cual ha sido rentable . Esta agradecido con kiva y MiCredito por la oportunidad que le brindaron con el préstamo anterior ya que logro comprar los materiales que necesitaba, mejoro su calidad de vida y su negocio aumento siendo reconocido en toda la ciudad. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar un motor beligerante, cables, pegamento, gas, mangeras, etc. su meta futuro es ser un empresario y cancelar el crédito trabajando dia a dia para ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Octavio is a native of the city of Esteli. He repairs refrigerators, a trade that has proven to be profitable.

Octavio is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the opportunity they offered him with a previous loan with which he bought materials he needed, improving his quality of life. His business grew, becoming recognized all over the city.

Octavio is requesting a new loan for the purchase of a motor, cables, glue, refrigerant gas, hoses, etc. His future goal is to be an entrepreneur and to pay off his loan, working day to day to expand his business and obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy a motor, cables, glue, refrigerant gas, hoses, etc., for his refrigerator repair business.

loans.name: Preap

texts.en:
Preap lives in a peaceful village of the Krolanh district, Siem Reap province, which is well-known for its Angkor Wat temple. Preap is married and a father of three children, who live with him in his own house. He has been a driver for a land transport company for almost two years and has his two sons working with him in order to share their responsibilities to this family. Aside from his main duties, he is also involved in farming to give his wife a helping hand.

Preap visited HKL to ask for a loan to build a bathroom in his home. As shown in the photo, he is standing with his wife in front of their bathroom. He hopes the loan will be approved, giving him the opportunity which will improve his family's health and increase the value of his house.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina, de 51 años, es una mujer buena y muy amable, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad principal de Carolina consiste en la venta de diversos productos alimenticios que ella misma se encarga de preparar diariamente. Ofrece a la venta productos derivados del cerdo, asimismo prepara alimentos regionales de la selva peruana. Ella posee este gran don culinario y es conocida como una de las mujeres que tiene la sazón más exquisita en la ciudad. Tiene un puesto de ventas estratégicamente ubicado en el mercado principal de su localidad. Aún recuerda con nostalgia pero con mucho orgullo como se inició en este trabajo hace 25 años y ha visto con el paso del tiempo que su esfuerzo y constancia por consolidarse en el mercado laboral le ha dado frutos y logros que ahora puede disfrutar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar sus comidas, disfrutar de los aromas y sabores y saber que sus fieles comensales disfrutan de cada platillo que ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando con el cumplimiento de sus metas, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero solicitado comprará ingredientes que utiliza a diario para preparar los alimentos que vende como carnes, arroz, condimentos, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Carolina, 51, is admirable and friendly. She is married and has three children, who live with her in her own house. Carolina sells food that she prepares daily, including pork items and regional dishes of the Peruvian rainforest. She has a culinary gift and is known in the city for her great sense of seasoning. Her food stand is strategically located in the main local market. She proudly and nostalgically recalls that she started this business 25 years ago. Her efforts and continued presence in the labor market over time have born fruit and resulted in achievements that she can now enjoy. 

What Carolina most enjoys about her work is preparing the food, savoring the aroma and flavor, and knowing that each dish pleases her loyal customers. She has applied for a loan of 1000 soles, and she is very happy to have funding to keep working toward her goals. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan to buy ingredients that she uses daily to prepare her dishes such as meats, rice, condiments, and oil.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meats, rice, condiments, and oil.

loans.name: Gusein

texts.en:
Gusein is a 29-year-old enthusiastic young man living with his spouse, two school age children, and parents. Gusein is jobless at the moment and the only income for the family is the small monthly salaries earned by his parents. His father works as a security guard and his mother is a cleaner.

Gusein's aged parents work hard all day long to help their son during financial difficulties.

Gusein tirelessly seeks a job, but there is a high unemployment rate in the region and it's very hard to find a suitable one. That's why he decided to start his own business.

With this start-up credit Gusein will renovate his own garage, purchase all the needed equipment and set up an auto repair shop there. He will work as a tinman and serve the local drivers in return for a fee.

Gusein hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative and he will make his family member's life easier.

loans.use: to renovate his garage, purchase equipment, and start an auto repair shop

loans.name: Joyce Mathew

texts.en: Joyce has been a Finance South Sudan Limited client for about two years now. This is the third time she is borrowing with us. She is 32 years of age, married, and has four children of whom three go to school. She sells items like beans, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, and rice in an open market. She is borrowing a loan worth 400 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more stock for resale. She intends to use the profits to pay back the loan and to pay school fees, food and medication for her family.

loans.use: To buy items like beans, cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri is a single woman of fifty-seven; she has four children and two grandchildren. Njeri owns rental houses and also sells eggs in bulk. She has been in this business for five years and gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Njeri's third loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the money to renovate the rentals. In the future she wants to be a prosperous business woman.

loans.use: To renovate rental houses

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is 22 years old from Migori, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports two people in his family and is married to Esther, who is also a business lady. They have no children yet.

Rajab sells new clothes within Migori market, a business he has been operating for the last six years and generates a monthly income of 9000 KES from the business. He has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more new clothes to sell. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Rajab's dream is to have a stable business and take care of his family as well as to be a role model in the society.

loans.use: to increase the number of new clothes to sell

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos de 30 y 24 años de edad respectivamente. Herlinda se dedica, es el cultivo de papas, zanahorias, alverjas, etc. Todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en los mercados de su localidad, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos enfermen sus productos. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y así obtener mejores ingresos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Herlinda, invertirá S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 51, is a very unassuming, hardworking woman living in her own house with her two children who are 30 and 24 years of age respectively.  Herlinda works growing potatoes, carrots, peas, etc.  She starts working in her fields very early every day because she knows that the money she earns from her crops very much depends on their quality.  She sells her products in local markets because that’s where she’s paid the best prices.  

What she likes best about her work is harvesting the land because that’s when she sees the fruit of her long months of hard labor.  She’s been doing this work for 21 years and has always considered fumigating the land to be the most difficult part because the danger of the chemicals damaging the crops is always present.  For later on, she hopes to improve her crops to earn higher income that way.  

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 2,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Angel Alipio

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 50   años de edad, es casado, tiene un   hijo, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Ángel se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado. 

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 50, is married and has one child.  He lives with his wife in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The Palmasola communal bank is located in the Palmasola precinct in the Ricaurte parish, Urdaneta canton.  The members do agricultural work and work with livestock.

Ángel is a farmer, and he grows corn and rice.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers.  With the support of the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers for a lower price because it will be a cash purchase.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every week.

His dream is to buy some land.  His challenge is climate changes.  He likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a devoted wife. She expresses her commitment and full devotion to her family, and to her business as well. 

She has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for two years. The profits earned from the business allows her to pay the school fees and allowances of her children. 

At this moment, Sheila wants to strengthen her business, but has inadequate business funds, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other condiments. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' usual product requests. 

In the future, Sheila aims to have a larger business to earn higher revenue.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy, de 23 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, esta casada y es madre de una niña de 5 con quien vive en la casa de sus suegros. Cindy se dedica a la venta de pescado de diferentes especies, tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias económicas debido a la clientela fluida que diariamente tiene, asegura que este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los mejores pescados tiene que madrugar e ir al puerto de la ciudad a las 4 de la mañana, sin embargo, ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 2 años y trabaja al lado de su esposo. Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las mejores especies y tamaños.
texts.en:
Cindy, age 23, is a hard-working young woman.  She is married, and she has a five year old daughter with whom she lives in her mother and father-in-law’s house.  Cindy sells different types of fish.  She has a sales stand at one of the busiest markets.  Fortunately, she has good sales and considerable income.  This is due to the daily customer flow that she has.  

She affirms that this work calls for a lot of sacrifice because in order to get the best fish she has to get up early and go to the city port at 4:00 a.m.  Nevertheless, she knows that all of her effort is worth it.  She is compensated when she sees that her little daughter has everything she needs to be comfortable.

She has been in this business for close to two years.  She works at her husband’s side.  She likes the freedom that this business provides.  She is able to have fun in the afternoons playing and practicing some sports, and she can be at her family’s side.

She will now request a loan for 2,500 soles.  She is happy for the financial support that she is provided with in order to be able to get ahead in her work.  Also, she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the loan to buy the best types and sizes of fish.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish wholesale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of forty-four years, married to Mary and the father of four children. He runs a taxi transport business in Kangemi and has been in this business for fourteen years. He gets a monthly income of KES 60,000.

This will be Peter's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire money to buy tires and spare parts for the taxi. In the future he wants to own a car hire firm.

loans.use: To buy new tires and spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a man of 45, married to Mary and the father of three children. He has rental houses, and also operates a transport business in Kiambu. He has been in this business for six years, and gets a monthly income of KES.50,000.

This will be Robert's second loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire amount to renovate his rental houses. 

In the future, he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: To complete the renovation of rental houses

loans.name: Samith

texts.en:
Samith is a 56 year old mother of three kids. Her family is living in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat where she does rice farming. She grows five hectares of rice and works for others for a fee. Her husband grows cassava for extra income. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years.

Samith is a new client for VIsionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan in order to pay plowing fees and to buy potash for her crop. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make a good living.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

loans.name: Celia Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Celia tiene 40 años de edad procreo 2 hijos los cuales el mayor tiene 14 años y estudia el tercer año del ciclo común y la menor tiene 12 años y está cursando el primer año del ciclo común su conyugue quien es agricultor es quien se encarga al 100% del rubro de café. Su fuente de ingreso económico es la venta del café ya que ella sabe realizar todas las actividades relacionadas con el negocio sin embargo apoya a su esposo hasta en la corta y traslado del mismo. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres y luego continúo con el esposo. Como mujer emprendedora tiene otros ingresos vende cosméticos y para la temporada vende alimentación a los obreros que llegan a trabajar durante la corta. La tierra que ella en compañía de su esposo trabajan es propia ubicadas aproximadamente a 4 minutos  de su casa de habitación. Sus clientes a quienes ella vende el café  son bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café en el municipio donde ella habita.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento el cual le permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como chapola (plantitas de café), abono y otra parte la destinara para la preparación de una tierra para sembrar la chapola que comprara.

Su sueño es graduar a sus dos hijos de una carrera universitaria ya que ella y su esposo no pudieron culminar sus estudios. Su meta con el negocio es hacerlo crecer al máximo para asegurarles el futuro económico a sus hijos, y ella considera que este logro lo podrá efectuar con optimismo, sabiduría y esmero y una buena administración de sus ganancias en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Celia, 40, has two children: the oldest is 14 and is in the third year of high school; and the youngest is 12 and in the first year of high school. Her husband is a farmer and is in charge of the coffee crop. Their income source is coffee sales. Celia heads the business operations associated with sales, but she also helps her husband with cutting and transporting the coffee. She learned this trade from her parents and continues to work at it with her husband.

As an enterprising women, she also earns money selling cosmetics and selling food to seasonal harvest workers. The land she and her husband own is about four minutes from their house. Their coffee customers are local stores that sell coffee exclusively. 

She has applied for a loan to buy coffee seedlings, manure, and other supplies to plant and maintain her coffee crop. She dreams of seeing her children graduate from college, as she and her husband were not able to finish school. Her business goal is to expand as much as possible so that her children will have a bright financial future, a goal she is optimistic about if pursued with wisdom, effort, and good administration of the profits.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings, manure, and other supplies to plant and maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Nanjii

texts.en:
Mr. Nanjii, 56 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, an easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been making and selling Mongolian traditional furniture to local people for over twenty years. All of his children are married, and live separately. 

Before this business, he had worked as a maintenance technician for 23 years. His wife teaches the Mongolian language at a high school. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years, and needs some serious repair and insulation. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, foam, fiberglass, and planks. Using those materials, with the help of some of his children, he can repair and insulate his house and make it more comfortable and warmer. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, which results in less air pollution. 

The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa continua con la elaboración de panes y con en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”.

Elsa agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar insumos entonces hoy en día ella requiere el préstamo para comprar como por ejemplo  harina, manteca, mantequilla  y otras cosas.

Elsa vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa continues to make bread and participate in the Virgen de Chanca community bank.

Elsa deeply thanks all of the lenders who supported her previous loan, since it went very well and she was able to buy supplies. She currently needs another loan to buy flour, lard, butter, and other things.

Elsa lives in the city of Challabamba. Challabamba District is located in the Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Perú. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, butter, and other things.

loans.name: Saviour Ernayo

texts.en:
Saviour Ernayo is a client of Finance Sudan Limited, based in Nimule, South Sudan. He is married, with one child. 

Saviour Ernayo is a businessman who owns a boutique where he sells clothes and shoes. He has employed one person who helps him run the business. Saviour Ernayo is also an employed person and earns a monthly salary. 

He is borrowing a loan worth SSP 2,000 (South Sudanese Pounds) to expand the business and buy more stock. The business is doing well and he is sure that he will be able to pay back the loan without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for his boutique.

loans.name: Daivy

texts.en:
Daivy, 24 years of age, is married and is blessed with two children. 

She's been in a food-vending business for almost two years. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 350 per week. She cooks snacks in the afternoon and sells them around their village. 

Due to insufficient funds, Daivy decided to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 8,000, to purchase raw meat, cooking oil, soy sauce, powdered juice, and barbecue sticks, to use in her food-vending business. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can be able to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw meat, cooking oil, soy sauce, powdered juice, and barbecue sticks, to use in her food-vending business.

loans.name: Angel Patricio

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 36   años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos   hijos, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Urdaneta  Provincia de Los Ríos. 


La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.


Ángel se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes. 
Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ventanas cada semana.   Su sueño es comprar un terreno. 

Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 36 years old, single, and has two children. He lives with his parents in the Urdaneta canton in the Los Ríos province.

The solidarity group is called VRC Palmasola. It is located in the Palmasola precinct, which is in the Ricaurte parish in the Urdaneta canton. The members of the group make a living in agriculture and raising livestock.

Angel works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He requests the loan so that he can buy fertilizers. With the support of the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers at a lower price because he will buy them in bulk. He makes his purchases in Ventanas each week.

His dream is to buy land. His challenge is climate change. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
A mother in her late 40s and a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Thy is a widowed mother of two independent children. 

To strive for a living, she does rice cropping as her main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for ages, earning about KHR 24,000 per day. This is the first microloan for Thy with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). 

Thy leads a group of three to apply for a new loan of KHR 185,000 each (cumulatively, KHR 555,000). As the leader, Thy will spend her loan portion to buy below-the-ground items to build a proper latrine for her family. She highly believes that she can own a decent latrine to improve the hygienic practice of her family.

loans.use: to buy below-the-ground items to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca comenzó a realizar el año pasado la conversión de café convencional a café orgánico. Esto fue posible gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva. Con ese crédito pudo adquirir nueva planta de café para resembrar ciertas partes de su parcela. Para esta cosecha Francisca solicita nuevamente otro crédito pues este proceso de renovación le llevará por lo menos dos años más y necesita comprar más planta y fertilizante para su finca.
texts.en:
Francisca began the process of converting from conventional coffee to organic coffee. This was possible thanks to a loan she received from Kiva. With this loan, she was able to acquire new coffee seedlings to re-plant part of her fields.

For this harvest, Francisca requests another loan, since the conversion process will take at least two more years. She needs to buy more seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nuevo Viloroco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO VILOROCO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, trenzado de mantas, tejido de mantas, venta de queso, venta de helado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás invirtiendo en el mismo un pequeño capital que tenía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, arroz y aceite) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Viloroco” communal bank will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Janneth.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, blanket weaving, blanket knotting, cheese sales and ice-cream sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Janneth.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer having been invited to do so by one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a food business and she makes it known that she learned this business years ago investing a small amount of capital she had in it.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy noodles, rice and oil at nearby street markets and after manufacturing will sell in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to support her home as best possible because she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training, the loans and the health services.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice and oil.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila de 56 años es una mujer casada, tiene 7 hijos pero solo vive con tres de ellos en su casa propia. Teofila se dedica a la agricultura. Los días de está valiente mujer se centran en el trabajo arduo. Desde los 20 años se dedica a las labores del campo. En todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir sus terrenos agrícolas, su pequeña casa y sacar a sus hijos adelante, tiene sembríos de papa, arvejas y demás hortalizas en buen estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia. “Tengo 4 hijos que están en otra ciudad estudiando y les envió dinero para que terminen de estudiar, son mi orgullo”, afirma.
Teofila está preocupada por la salud de su esposo quien se encuentra en otra ciudad  al cuidado de sus hijos mayores. Ahora ella se hará cargo sola de las siembras de arvejas y maíz, para ello contratará trabajadores del lugar. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente orgullosa por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Teofila, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Teófila, 56, is married and has seven children but only three of them still live with her in her own house.  Teófila works in agriculture.  This valiant woman’s every day is centered on this hard work.  She’s worked in the fields since the age of 20 and in all this time has managed to acquire her own farmland, her little house and to move her children forward.  She grows potatoes, peas and other good-quality vegetables.  What she likes best about her work is being able to spend most of her time with her family.  “I have four children studying in another city and I send them money so they can finish their studies; they are my pride,” she affirms.

Teófila is concerned about her husband’s health; he lives in another city and their older children care for him.  Now she will be in charge of the pea and corn crops alone and to do so will hire local laborers. 

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels proud of the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  Teófila will use the 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. She has three children. She has been farming for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: Farming gives her a source of income. She said her biggest challenge is high input prices. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that the previous loan had helped her to expand her dairy farming projects, and now she wants to buy a chaff cutter (a tool for chopping up cattle feed efficiently.) This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and she replied:  'Microfinance gives loans with better terms than other financial institutions.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Rose replied that she will be able to improve the family's living standard.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns a cow, poultry, pump, and bicycle, but does not own a pig, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Agnela

texts.en: Agnela, who joined Yehu to access loan funds, appreciates the previous loan she received from Kiva that generated more business profits and helped her support her children. She is now requesting a loan of Ksh.40,000 to purchase fruits,vegetables, onions and milk.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, onions and milk

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth is 24 years old and married to Yi, who owns a small phone shop and provides phone repair service in their neighborhood of Bakan district, Pursat province. Puth helps her husband earn income by running a retail store that sells grocery items. She lives with her husband, father, and her younger sister in their own house.

Puth is requesting a loan of 1,000 U.S. dollars to build a bathroom in her house. She hopes the loan will be granted, thereby improving her family living conditions and creating a healthier environment for the whole community.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Delmy Idalia

texts.es:
Delmy,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar mariscos, tales como: pescado, sardinas, camarones y asimismo materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas, entre estos: quesillo, chicharrón,  condimentos, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus condiciones económicas, ya que logro aumentar  los productos y sus ventas, asimismo agrego otro tipo de rubro mas que es la venta de pupusas  y refrescos, también  las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado
texts.en:
Delmy needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital to invest in her business.  This investment will help her buy seafood like fish, sardines and shrimp and also to buy raw materials like string cheese, pork, condiments, etc. to make ‘pupusas’ [filled grilled corn cakes].

The last loan helped her to improve her economic conditions in that she managed to increase the products and her sales.  She also added another line of work: selling pupusas and soft-drinks.  Her family circumstances have also become optimized.

loans.use: to buy seafood, cheese, pork, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is a 52-year-old farmer from the Kareli district. She lives with her spouse, grown son, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren, and a school-age daughter. 

Nani cultivates agricultural land where various fruits and vegetables are grown. The harvests are sold locally. Her husband works as a constructor and her son is a worker at the metal and plastic workshop where doors and windows are produced. Both of the family members get small monthly salaries. 

The existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses for such a large family. That’s why Nani and her son decided to earn additional income and start a new business. Nani’s son is indentured to the workshop owner to provide him with raw materials, but he needed the car for transportation. With this start up credit, Nani will purchase the car for her son and he will start a distribution business.

According their estimations, the business will be successful and the family will get enough income to improve their living conditions. Nani is thankful, in advance, to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to use in a distribution business.

loans.name: Yatter

texts.en:
Yatter is 40 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 12 and 20. She runs a retail business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Two of her children are going to school; she also has one relative at home.

She's been in this business since 2007, and sells cigarettes, biscuits and sugar within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is that sometimes her purchasing power is very low.

Yatter requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits and sugar for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbaatar, 52 years old, lives with his son's family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife passed away, when their children were very young. He raised three children on his own, by working hard at a mining company as a truck driver. Today, he still works for this company and transports minerals between ports. His two daughters are both married and live separately.

The house in which Munkhbaatar lives, together with his son's family, has a deteriorated roof and windows. This makes the living space vulnerable to frosts and storms. With winter coming closer, Munkhbaatar is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase shingles, vacuum-insulated windows, and fiberglass insulation. Using those materials, he can renovate the house and make a comfortable and warm place for his grandchildren. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, so it will release less pollution into the air. The renovation of the house will contribute to Mongolia's efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who raised three children on his own with his hard work.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, vacuum-insulated windows, and fiberglass, for making his family's home more energy-efficient

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a room to his house.

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr: Homme de 41ans, Mr Comlan est marié à une revendeuse et a 02 enfants en charge. L’ainé de 06ans va pour le moment à l’école. Pour subvenir aux mieux aux besoins de la famille, il revend depuis 2010 des produits congelés dans sa boutique et en même temps des produits d’alimentation générale. Il voudrait augmenter son stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille avec le profit tiré de son cinquième prêt à WAGES.
texts.en: A 41-year-old man, Mr. Comlan is married to a retailer and has two children to support. The oldest is 6 years old and attending school for now. To do better in meeting the needs of the family, Mr. Comlan has been selling frozen products in his store since 2006, and at the same time he sells grocery items. With the profits from his fifth WAGES loan, he would like to increase his stock of merchandise and to ensure his family will thrive.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  LAIDOU   est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et. 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  MEDINE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habillements à travers de SALI, elle est la 2éme femme debout dans la photos de la  droite vers la gauche. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 colis de friperies à  Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This group LAIDOU is composed of four women, all married, who average 38 years of age and 5 children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the MEDINE district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for operating their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth loan. The three previous loans were correctly repaid. 

This group of women does commerce in clothing through SALI, who is the second woman standing from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 packages of secondhand clothing from Bamako. Accepting cash or credit at the market and at home, she makes her sales to a customer base composed essentially of women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Âgée de 48ans, Ayélé est veuve et a en charge 02 enfants de 22 et 15ans qui sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle  a démarré en 2006 par vendre des trousseaux bébé. Son quatrième crédit l’aidera à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle espère avec le profit développer son activité et assurer un avenir radieux à la famille.
texts.en: Ayélé  is 48 years old and a widow supporting two children, aged 22 and 15, who are both in school. To meet the needs of the family, she started selling baby clothing and accessories in 2006. Her fourth loan will help her to stock up on merchandise to satisfy customer needs. She hopes to use the profits to develop her business and to ensure a bright future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothing and accessories

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belén, de 55 años, está casada con Walter con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores e independientes, por eso ella vive a lado de su esposo en su casa propia. Belén se dedica a la venta de productos como gaseosas, harinas, golosinas, jugos, huevos y otros productos envasados. Tiene instalado en su vivienda una vitrina amplia en donde exhibe todos los productos que pone a la venta.  Del mismo modo traslada de manera quincenal la misma mercadería hacia otras poblaciones aledañas que se encuentran en las orillas de los ríos, estos viajes pueden tardar hasta una semana de recorrido. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de movilizar la pesada mercadería. Lleva en este negocio 11 años y le va muy bien, por otra parte tiene un mototaxi que alquila a un conductor a cambio de un pago diario. Durante todo el tiempo que se dedica a su negocio siente que aprendió y avanzó mucho ya que tiene la satisfacción de tener sus propios ingresos y además disponer de su tiempo como ella mejor lo crea conveniente, se siente contenta trabajando al lado de su esposo ya que eso le brinda mayor seguridad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos productos para enviarlos a otras localidades como huevos, yogurt, jugos, harinas, arroz, gaseosas y otros.
texts.en:
Belén, 55 years old, is married to Walter. They have four adult children who are now independent. Belén and Walter live together in a house they own. Belén runs a small store out of her home, from which she sells soft drinks, flour, candy, juice, eggs and other bottled items. She has a wide display window where she advertises all the items she has for sale. Every two weeks, she also brings this merchandise to bordering towns on the shore of the rivers. These trips can last up to a week. Belén works with her husband's help: he is in charge of moving all the heavy merchandise. Belén has worked in this business for 11 years and has been very successful. She also owns a motor taxi that she rents out to drivers daily. In the last 11 years, Belén has learned a lot and advanced her business because she enjoys the satisfaction of earning her own money and being able to make her own schedule. She is very happy to be working alongside her husband and to help secure their financial situation.

Belén is requesting a loan of 3,800 Peruvian soles. She is very grateful to everyone who has made this opportunity possible because she needs it to achieve her work-related goals. Belén will use this loan to buy various products to sell in bordering towns such as eggs, yogurt, juice, flour, rice, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy eggs, yogurt, juices, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is 38 years old, married, and supports three of his children, aged between 10 and 5 years. He has been selling different types and sizes of tyres in the Eldama - Ravine area, Kenya. He has been in operation for a period of over 16 years, earning an income of KES 50,000.

This is his fifth term loan from KADET, and he borrowed KES 120,000. He wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock of tyres for resale. The profits he earns will be used to pay his children's school fees and to repay the loan. He hopes to grow in business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tyres for resale

loans.name: Marina Martha

texts.es: Durate la cosecha pasada Martha y su esposo resembraron gran parte de su finca pues tienen como meta aumentar su producción a 12 toneladas en las próximos años. Esto fue posible gracias a un crédito que obtuvieron por parte de Kiva. Las plantas de café tardan aproximadamente 3 años en comenzar a dar sus primeros frutos sin embargo deben invertir en fertilizantes para que crezcan bien y den granos de calidad y por esa razón nuevamente necesita de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
During the previous harvest, Martha and her husband replanted a large part of their farm so that they could increase their production to 12 tons in the next few years. This was made possible thanks to the loan they obtained from Kiva.

The coffee plants take approximately three years to begin bearing fruit, so they will invest in fertilizers so that their crops can grow well and produce quality beans. For this reason, Martha needs another loan that she will repay at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, es una persona que está acompañada, disfruta de tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 14, 18 y 19 años, no posee familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos, tales como: maíz, frijol, maicillo y crianza de ganado, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 25 años y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita don José, le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, entre estos están: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas. Esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir los materiales agrícolas para el cultivo y con las ganancias poder aportar para su familia. 
Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is in a relationship and enjoys his three children who are 14, 18, and 19 years of age. He has no relatives who are living abroad. José is a farmer who grows basic staples such as corn, beans, and sorghum. He also raises livestock. José has been in this profession for 25 years and works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. At the moment, he does not have any financial difficulties.

Don José is requesting a loan so that he can buy needed farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides. This investment will help him to acquire farming materials for his crops and to generate income to support his family. His dream is to build a home of his own and to support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Auma Vini

texts.en:
Auma used the previous loan to grow her business very well, and she has expanded it to the point where it is now almost completely wholesale. Very thankful for that loan, Auma is requesting a new one for 2500 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, maize and other cereals.

In business for over three years now, Auma is seeing herself succeed more and more. She says that she has really benefited from the financial support that loans offer.

loans.use: To buy food items like beans, maize and other cereals

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Mariatu, who is from Tombo, in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.

Mariatu established her home products sales business in 2007. She began her business, because she wanted to have a source of income with which to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the times when the purchasing power of customers is very low.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mariatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates to resell

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 42 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. Enkhbaatar has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2005. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, shortening routes, and driving them quickly. His elder son works as an engineer, at a mining company.

Enkhbaatar is requesting a loan of 2,150,000 MNT. He will use it to purchase building materials to use to renovate his house, such as shingles, bricks and cement. After he completes this project, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, without worrying about the upcoming harsh winter. Also, the renovated house will reduce the family's consumption of coal, contributing to Mongolia's efforts against air pollution. Coal burning is the main source for air pollution in Mongolia, according to a research department.

loans.use: to make his house warmer in winter, while reducing its contribution to air pollution by making it more energy-efficient

loans.name: Yagou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 femmes fait parti du banc villageois  qui a été créé le 25 juin 2002. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Yagou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 1 garçon, qui vit avec  ses enfants dans la maison.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va faire du commerce. Elle compte acheter du bissap, mil, niébé, de l'arachide pour revendre.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son fils à entretenir la famille en prenant en charge certains de ses besoins.
texts.en: This group of five women are members of a village bank that was created on 25 June 2002.  The bank gathers women who live in the same village and neighboring villages.  The women enjoy good relations and work in business and at fattening animals.  Yagou, standing at the right of the photo with her hand raised is 55-years old.  She is married and mother of one son . She lives with his children in a house. With this loan, she will engage in business. She plans to buy hibiscus, millet, cowpeas, and groundnuts for resale.  The profits will enable her to support her son at supporting the family by taking care of some of his needs.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus, millet, cowpeas, groundnuts

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr: Les  femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Temou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Madeleine (2ème  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Temou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Markala et Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of "Benkadi 1" are all married in traditional families, and they average 43 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Temou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of supplying themselves with sundry equipment and paying for labor and weeding in the fields, the group found out about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first farm loan. 

Ms. Madeleine (second woman standing from the left in the photo) is a great leader in rainy season farm work in the village of Temou. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds and farm inputs from Markala and Ségou and sundry equipment from local blacksmiths; and to pay young people to weed her field. At the end of the season, the produce is sold in cash to repay the loan, thus leaving revenues for supporting the children, as well as the family.

loans.use: to purchase sundry equipment, seeds, and farm inputs and to pay for labor and weeding in the fields

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña Cándida es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada con 5 hijos los cuales son independientes. Se dedica al negocio de pulpería y transporte de carga desde hace 16 años. Su mayor apoyo es su esposo que con sacrificio y esfuerzo han logrado salir adelante. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso la venta  botellas y plásticos que comercializa en su casa. Estima que al obtener el crédito sera de mucho beneficio ya que podrá aumentar sus ingresos y surtir su pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, Aceite, pasta dental y jabón. Su meta futuro es  convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Doña Cándida is originally from the city of Granada. She is 49 years old, married, and has five children who are independent. Cándida has been in the business of selling merchandise from her shop and transporting cargo for 16 years. Her greatest support is her husband who has worked and sacrificed so that they could get ahead.

Cándida generates extra income by selling bottles and plastics from her home. She believes that obtaining a loan will be of great benefit in increasing her earnings and restocking her shop. Cándida is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and soap. Her goal for the future is to covert her shop into a variety store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, toothpaste, and soap.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
