Doña María es una muy buena persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con  su  hijo y esposo en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Ella se dedica a la costura de ropa para dama.  
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de telas, agujas,  botones, hilo, botones y cipers. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas  aumenten ya que tendrá  una  gran  variedad de telas para hacer diversas clases de ropas  que  atraigan  más clientes. 
Doña María espera así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que su condición de  vida y  la de su familia mejore con esta inversión. 
Doña María  espera  que en 1 año  su negocio sea el más  conocido de su caserío   y  de esta forma  seguir apoyando a  su  hijos en sus estudios  para  que se conviertan en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio   2013
texts.en:
Doña María is an outstanding individual who is honest, responsible, and hardworking. She lives with her husband and child in a community in southern Honduras. She is a seamstress who produces women’s clothing.

Doña María needs a loan so that she can buy fabrics, needles, buttons, thread, and zippers. With this loan she hopes to increase her sales. By having a wide variety of fabrics, she will be able to produce different styles of clothing to attract more customers.

Doña María hopes to cover her necessities and also improve the living conditions for herself and her family. Within one year, she expects her business to become the most well-known in her community. This will enable her to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can become successful people.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, buttons, thread, and zippers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de.46 ans et. 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier NIEBALA  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  bijoux de fabrication artisanales  à travers  MARIAM, elle est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20 douzaines de chaines et de boucles d’oreille avec les fabricants de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes à BOUGOUNI   et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of four  married women, who average 46 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the NIEBALA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for operating their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth loan. The three previous ones were correctly paid back.

This group of women does commerce in artisanal jewelry through MARIAM, who is the second woman sitting from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 dozen chains and earrings from makers in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit in Bamako and at home, she makes her sales to a customer base composed essentially of women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal jewelry to sell

loans.name: N’Tekokoumamen Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   N’TEKOKOUMAMEN    est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier HEREMAKONO NORD  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits cosmétiques à travers de  FLASSOUN  debout au milieu. Elle fait l’achat vente de produits cosmétiques  et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 cartons de crèmes et 4 cartons de parfums à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group N’TEKOKOUMAMEN is composed of five women, who average 35 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for operating their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan.

This group of women does commerce in cosmetics through FLASSOUN, who is standing in the middle in the photo. She buys and sells cosmetic products and intends to use her loan to purchase 5 boxes of creams and 4 boxes of perfumes in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit at the market and at home, she makes her sales to a customer base composed essentially of women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Fatmata from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 7 months and 14 years. In 2006, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to survive. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of enough capital to run her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more waxed cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to own a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more waxed cotton for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 5 bags of dry okra, cabbage and tomatoes.

loans.name: Khurelbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelbaatar, 33 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land. 

He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2008. This spring, he began building a new house on plot of land and due to a lack of financing, he can't complete building the house. So he is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, and metal. 

Building his house will have many benefits, such as reduced coal burning for heating, a more spacious place to live, and will be environmentally friendly because a high quality house will preserve energy longer and burn less coal which results in less smoke and air pollutants. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, planks and metal to finish his house.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. His wife is currently unemployed. 

He has owned a small plot of land, where he cultivates fruits and vegetables, for the past 28 years. He takes good care of his land so as to produce good quality products, which he sells to multiple stores and traders. He has ten part-timers, both females and males, helping him with the operation. 

Today he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fertilizer and pesticides so his products grow faster. He needs to augment his productivity to earn more income to satisfy his family’s needs, pay the high costs of living, and pay his workers. 

This will be his second Kiva loan, and we note that he was a very good client with payments on time. 

In the future, Taleb looks forward to further expand his business by opening his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Temou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Hawa 2ème  femme à partie de la droite  dans la photo, compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Markala et Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 women of Benkadi 3 are all married in traditional families.  They have an average age of 44 and four children. They all live in the same village of Temou, in the region of Segou (the fourth largest administrative region in Mali). They met through their winter agricultural activities, neighborhood ties, marriage, and kinship in the village. They are in the business of cultivating groundnuts, millet, and rice. In order to buy small equipment, stock up on agricultural inputs, and pay labor for weeding fields, the members of this group contacted Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan.  Ms. Hawa, the second woman at the right of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Markala and Segou, small equipment from local blacksmiths, and to pay youth to weed her field.  The sale of her agricultural products is made in cash at the end of the rainy season to pay her loan and in order to have income to take care of her children as well as part of the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs, and to pay labor for weeding fields.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de Granada, oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa. Esta agradecida con kiva y mi crédito ya que con su préstamo logro surtir su negocio comprando variedad de productos, obtener  mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar Blusas, camisetas, pantalones, faldas y electrodomésticos. Su meta futuro  es mejorar las infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is originally from Granada. She works as a retailer, selling clothing. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because her loan allowed her to stock her business by purchasing a variety of products. She obtained higher income and was able to satisfy her customers' needs. 

She is requesting a new loan to buy blouses, pants, skirts, and appliances.  

Her goal for the future is to improve her home's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, and appliances.

loans.name: Maria Agripina

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa, asimismo vende medicina natural y esto lo realiza para obtener ingresos necesarios, por lo que la Sra. Maria solicita un prestamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio  y aumentar sus ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: faldas, camisas, blusas, pantalones, entre otros y medicina natural.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ganancias  y  obtener mayor clientela satisfechos por el servicio que reciben. Tambien su aspiración es  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her family. She works selling clothing, but she also sells natural remedies to supplement her income. Maria is requesting a loan to strengthen her business and increase her income. This investment will help her purchase a variety of merchandise, such as skirts, shirts, blouses, pants, other clothing items, and natural remedies. 

Her dream is to improve her earnings, to reach a broader customer base, and for her customers to be satisfied with the service they receive. She also aspires to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, blouses, pants, other clothing items, and natural remedies.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Aminata, from Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 6 and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2009, Aminata established her home products business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes the purchasing power of customers is very low.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Aminata plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Amadeo pudo fertilizar y realizar todas las lobores necesarias en su finca gracias a que obtuvo un crédito de Kiva, el cual utilizó en su totalidad para invertir en su terreno. Para este año espera que los resultados se vean reflejados en el aumento de su producción y para que esto suceda necesita comprar fertilizantes y realizar algunos trabajos en sus parcelas y por eso solicita nuevamente de un crédto el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: During the last harvest Amadeo fertilised his crops and carried out all the necessary jobs on his farm.  This was made possible by a Kiva loan, all of which he used to invest in his land.  This year, he hopes this will result in increased production and, to ensure that this is the case, he needs to buy fertiliser and to carry out some jobs on his plots of land.  For this reason, he is seeking a new loan which he will repay at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and clean up his farm

loans.name: Al Warda Group

texts.en:
Raghida is the featured borrower of Al Warda group. She got together with her other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Raghida is a 32-year-old married mother of four children. She is the second from the right, wearing a white veil. She has been working selling clothes for six months to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's requested increasing needs.

Raghida is working hard to provide her family with their necessary needs. She also helps her husband in taking care of her mother-in-law to provide her with a caring and healthy living medium.

Her applied for loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a new clothes collection. She hopes to keep on developing her business to satisfy both her family members and customers at the same time.

As for the other group members, Amal is the first from the right, Ghada is the lady in blue, and Nisrine is the first from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Temou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Nana 2ème  femme à partir de la droite  compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Markala et Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Benkadi 2 are married women who live in traditional families. They average 40 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in the village of Temou, region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, through ties of marriage and kinship, and through the farming activities they practice during the rainy season. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice. 

They joined the mricrofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy small farming equipment, to stock up on inputs and to pay for the cost of plowing the fields. This is the group’s 1st loan cycle with the MFI. Mrs. Nana, 2nd from the right, plans to use her loan to buy seeds and inputs in Markala and Ségou and small farming equipment from local blacksmiths, and to pay the young helpers who will be plowing her field. 

At the end of the rainy season, she will sell her crop for cash. This will allow her to repay her loan and to support her children, and also to help provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy small farming equipment, seeds and inputs, and to pay for plowing labor.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is 38 years old and lives in a small village of Ratevani, with his spouse. Malkhaz is a laborer at the local stone workshop, and his wife works at the milk factory. He requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but had no success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Recently, Malkhaz requested credit from Credo. He was planning to restart-up his animal husbandry business, which he had stopped due to a lack of economic resources. His loan request was approved, through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to mainstream credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers,” due to low income.

With the received credit, Malkhaz will purchase several calves and build a shed in his yard. He will keep the cattle in the newly-built shed, raise and sell them over five to six months. He will take good care of the calves, which he can do because he has previous experience working with livestock. After selling the calves, he will purchase more of them and go through the same cycle. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family, and Malkhaz will be able to generate profit.

loans.use: to purchase calves and build a cattle shed

loans.name: Mahrum

texts.en: Mahrum is a 58-year-old married woman. For many years she has been successfully running a business of milk sales. Over time, Mahrum has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is a hardworking woman and the mother of five children. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, 35 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store for a period of about one year, with the support of her son. She offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Shamim needs to have various goods in stock, to efficiently meet customers’ demands. 

Currently, Shamim has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional grocery items, including oil, milk, sugar, and juices. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for her store, including oil, milk, sugar, and juices.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La  joven  Claudia  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos  en  una  comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  una  pulpería el cual le genera la mayor parte de sus ingresos. 
Claudia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, café, pan, leche, agua, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
La  joven Claudia  espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  para que se  convierta en una de las pulperías más grandes y reconocidas de la zona de esa forma seguir ayudando a hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  – Julio  del   2013
texts.en:
Claudia is a responsible, hardworking and honest young woman who lives with her children in a community in southern Honduras.  She runs a grocery shop which is the source of most of her income.  Claudia needs the loan to buy to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, coffee, bread, milk, water, etc. She hopes that the loan will lead to higher sales for her shop as she will have more goods on offer and will be able to offer better service to her customers.  Claudia hopes to be able to cover her needs and to improve her own and her family's quality of life a little.  Within a few years, she hopes to see her business continue to grow and become one of the biggest and most well-known grocery shops in the area. This will enable her to continue helping her children to become respectable members of society with good prospects.      



Choluteca, Honduras  – July   2013

loans.use: to buy lard, rice, beans, meat, coffee, bread, milk, water, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Con un crédito obtenido por Kiva durante la cosecha pasada Eugenio y su familia pudieron resembrar gran parte de su finca y también realizar labores de limpieza y preparación de la tierra. Con estas acciones esperan que dentro de dos años su cosecha aumente de 20 a 25 toneladas. Para poder lograr esto necesitan comprar fertilizantes y por eso nuevamente solicitan el apoyo de Kiva mediante un crédito para poder alcanzar su meta.
texts.en: With a Kiva loan obtained during the previous harvest, Eugenio and his family were able to replant a large part of his farm and also to do weeding and soil preparation tasks.  With these actions they hope that in two years crop yield will increase from 20 tons to 25 tons.  In order to attain this they need to buy fertilizer so are once again requesting Kiva’s support by means of a loan to reach their goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Crhis

texts.es: Crhis, de 31 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años, con quien vive en una casa alquilada. Crhis se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, además de la venta de golosinas como caramelos, galletas, chocolates, chizitos y chicles. A diario acomoda en su refrigeradora sus productos y pone a exhibir en una vitrina todo lo que ofrece, se abastece de las bebidas dos veces por semana mientras que las golosinas los compra semanalmente. Lleva realizando este trabajo hace 3 años y desde que empezó siempre lo ha hecho sola. Además, cada fin de semana vende comidas típicas y otros platillos peruanos ya que su experiencia y buena sazón le permite preparar los potajes que le solicitan. Su negocio marcha adecuadamente y espera seguir trabajando mucho más para continuar progresando y mejorar la economía de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 y agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo destinará a la compra de gaseosas de diversos sabores y golosinas como galletas y caramelos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Crhis, 31, is a kind, good, hardworking married woman who has a little five-year-old son she lives with in a rented house.  Crhis works selling soft-drinks and snacks like candy, cookies, chocolates, cheese puffs and chewing gum.  

She arranges her products daily in a refrigerator and displays everything she has in a display case.  She stocks up on soft-drinks twice a week and buys the snacks weekly.  She’s been doing this work for three years and has worked alone since the beginning.  

Also, she sells traditional and other Peruvian dishes weekends because her experience and tasty way of cooking allows her to prepare the dishes she’s requested.  Her business is moving along adequately and she hopes to continue working much more to continue making progress and improving her home’s economy.

On this occasion she will request 2,500 soles and she thanks those who will provide the loan she needs to continue developing her business.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested amount to buy soft-drinks in assorted flavors and snacks like cookies and candy at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy snacks and soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin,  requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que los créditos son una fuente generadora de ingresos para los negocios; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar 5 juegos de mesa de madera y material para la cocina.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que fortaleció el negocio porque logro crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar, gracias a ello las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Marvin needs to opt for a new loan because loans are an income-generating source for business.  This investment will help him buy five wood dining room sets and kitchen supplies.

His previous loan was positive in that it strengthened the business because he grew and was able to have everything necessary to work.  Thanks to this his economic condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy five wood dining room sets and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y su hijo, nuera y nietos. El, posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, dicha actividad la desempeña con su hijo y un sobrino, lo realiza todos los días, ya que el taller lo tiene en su casa, oficio que lo aprendió desde muy joven con  unos amigos. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar un vehículo que le servirá para hacer viajes y para trasladar el material para su taller. Esta inversión le ayudara a llevar personalmente a domicilio los trabajos realizados de estructuras metálicas   y esto le generara otros ingresos.
Su sueño es ampliar mas su taller y de esta forma mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his family consisting of his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchildren.  He owns a metal shop and he carries out his activities with his son and nephew.  He works every day since his shop is home-based.  He learned his occupation from some friends while still very young.

The loan he’s requesting will make it possible for him to buy a vehicle to make trips and transport materials for his shop.  This investment will help him to make home deliveries personally of the finished metal structures and this will generate other income.  His dream is to expand the shop more thus improving his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a work vehicle.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is an 18-year-old, single man from Lebanon. He got involved in the construction field in 2010. He had to start his career at a young age to supplement the family’s income and to live in better conditions. He works independently, responding promptly to customer’s demands. Recently, he employed a part-time worker to assist him. Therefore, he had to afford more expenses. 

At this time, Samer is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to purchase new tools and materials needed, such as hammers and cement, to accomplish his job properly and to benefit from the high returns. 

In the future, Samer hopes to take multiple construction projects in order to further expand his business operations, make superior income, and be able to enhance his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos y dos nietos. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos, dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres desde muy joven, sus hijos y nietos le ayudan a trabajar; además posee un chalet en la escuela que le genera ingresos; hoy en día desde que falleció su esposo, es quien lleva los gastos del hogar. Ventaja que tiene es que las tierras donde cultiva son propias y muy buenas para el cultivo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su cultivo también prepararse para las postreras y esto generara ingresos económicos a su familia.
El sueño de la Sra. María es obtener excelente cosechas esta temporada y así sus utilidades serán mejores.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children and her two grandchildren.  She works in agriculture growing basic grains, an occupation she learned from her parents while still very young.  Her children and grandchildren help her with the work.  She also has a snack bar at a school that generates income.  Today, since her husband’s death, she must cover all household expenses.  The advantage she has is that she owns the land she farms and that it’s very good for farming.

The loan she needs will help her buy necessary agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide and insecticide.  This investment will help her improve her crop and also to get ready for the end and this will generate income for her family.  María’s dream is to get excellent harvests this season so her profits will be better.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que la Institución brinda; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar cuatro llantas para el vehículo personal que posee.
El crédito anterior le permitió darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y con ello logro garantizar el traslado de sus clientes; asimismo las condiciones económicas mejoraron porque logra siempre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y adquirió otro taxi.
texts.en:
Carlos needs to take out another loan because he needs more working capital and because of the good service the institution provides.  This investment will help him buy four tires for his personal vehicle.

The previous loan helped him service the vehicle thus guaranteeing his passengers’ transport.  Also, his economic conditions improved because he’s now able to always support his children’s schooling and he bought another taxi.

loans.use: to buy four tires.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere capital de trabajo y por que los créditos son una fuente favorable de ingresos, asimismo de ayuda  para el hogar; esta inversión le permitira comprar  materia prima, tales como: agujas,  hilo de seda para confeccionar las hamacas.
El crédito anterior le sirvió para mantenerse en su negocio, por lo que las condiciones económicas se mantienen igual y también las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Noel needs to request a new loan because he needs working capital and loans are a good way of generating income.  They also help at home.  This investment will allow him to buy raw materials like needles and silk threat to make hammocks.

His previous loan helped him to stay in business so his economic conditions remained stable as did his family circumstances too.

loans.use: to buy needles and silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 36-year-old woman and a mother of five children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community, for the past eight years. She offers various goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and counts a good customer list. Her husband is a painter, but he earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

Shabana is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 45,000. She will use this amount to buy a stock of grocery items to sell at her store, such as grains, sugar and flour, together with packages of cleaning products, like detergents and soap. She wishes to spend part of the profit to deal with her children’s education expenses, and another part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grocery items to sell at her store, such as grains, sugar and flour, together with packages of cleaning products, like detergents and soap.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She and her husband are in the business of making costume jewelry and have been for many years. The business has great potential for growth, and Nasreen is actively helping her husband, as this business is the only source of income for them.

In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Nasreen is applying for a 40,000 PKR loan through Kashf to buy materials such as silver and gold plus artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her income and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a good-quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials such as silver and gold plus artificial gems and pearls

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 28-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. One of her sons is shown in the picture. 

Mukhtaran has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals (e.g., baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market, at higher prices. 

Currently, Mukhtaran requests a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es: Laura, a sus 42 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos. Ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, pues el padre de sus hijos nunca le ha colaborado con dinero para el sustento, por lo que decidió buscar opciones para generar ingresos por cuenta propia y montó un pequeño taller de confección, trabajando arduas jornadas de Lunes a Domingo de 8:00 am a 10:00 pm, y así ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Su negocio fue creciendo paulatinamente y, hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleadas directas, pues pasó de realizar arreglos de modistería, a tener contratos con diferentes empresas para las cuales confecciona. Laura es una mujer emprendedora, pujante, centrada en los objetivos que desea lograr y por los cuales lucha incansablemente para conseguirlos. Es por esto que se anima a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de una máquina plana e insumos al por mayor (hilos, elásticos, telas); esto le abrirá las puertas para firmar nuevos contratos con otras empresas y tendrá suficiente disponibilidad de materiales para cumplir con su producción, entregar un producto bien terminado y en el momento oportuno, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos. Laura sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, hacerlo crecer  para que sea sostenible en el tiempo y poder brindar más oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar. De esta manera cambiará su economía favorablemente para ofrecer a sus hijos una excelente educación, un mejor bienestar y un futuro más próspero.
texts.en:
Laura, 42, is a single mother of two children.  She’s gone through a very difficult economic situation because her children’s father has never contributed money for their support so she decided to find income-generating options on her own and set up a small sewing workshop.  She works hard shifts from Monday to Sunday from 8am until 10pm and this is how she’s managed to move her family forward.

Her business has grown step by step and today she has two employees because she went from doing dressmaking jobs to having contracts with various firms she sews for.  Laura is an enterprising, driven woman who is focused on the objectives she wants to attain and that she strives tirelessly to reach.

This is what encourages her to request a loan that will be used to buy plane sewing machine and supplies at wholesale (thread, elastic, fabric).  This will open doors to signing new contracts with other firms and she’ll have sufficient supplies on-hand to meet production goals and deliver a well-finished product on time which will be reflected in increased income.

Laura dreams with giving continuity to her business and to make it grow so that it will be sustainable over time and provide more employment opportunities to mothers who are heads of household.  In this way her economy will change favorably so she can offer her children an excellent education, better well-being and a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es:
Wilber, es una persona que está acompañada y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 3 y 5 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios, entre estos: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros para el cultivo. Esta inversión le ayudara al Sr. Wilber  fortalecer sus cultivos y obtener una excelente cosecha, por lo que ayudara a su familia.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y continuar trabajando la tierra.
texts.en:
Wilber lives with his common-law wife, and they are blessed with two children aged 3 and 5.  He does not have relatives living abroad.  He works as a farmer, growing staple crops such as corn and beans.  He has been doing this for ten years and works every day from 6 am to 3 pm.  So far, he has had no major difficulties.

He is seeking a loan to buy the agricultural supplies he needs for his crops, such as fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides and insecticides.  Making this investment will help him to fortify his crops and obtain an excellent harvest so that he can help his family.

His dream is to support his children in their studies and continue working the land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides, insecticides and other items.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 58 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, está casada y tiene 5 hijos a quienes brindó lo mejor para su educación, ahora ella vive solo junto a su esposo en su casa propia.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 7 años y le va muy bien. Por las tardes vende comida en la vereda de su casa aunque actualmente tiene todos sus esfuerzos orientados a expandir e incrementar su tienda de productos comestibles para generar sus ingresos económicos en la tranquilidad de su hogar. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues siempre considera que su pasión es la atención al público y el trato directo con sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, embutidos, leche, huevos, golosinas y otros productos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 58, is a kind, hardworking married woman with five children she gave the best to for their education; now she lives alone with her husband in her own house.

Nancy works selling foodstuffs.  She’s been in business about 7 years and has done very well.  In the evenings she sells food on the sidewalk by her house although right now all her efforts are focused on expanding and enlarging her grocery store to earn income in the tranquility of home.  She likes what she does very much because she considers providing service to the public her passion and she enjoys the personal interchange with her customers.  

On this occasion she will request 2,500 soles.  She’s very excited to know that there are people who provide economic back-up so she can continue developing her work activity.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested amount to buy products like rice, sugar, oil, canned goods, milk, eggs, snacks and others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hernan Pastor

texts.es: El Sr. Hernán  tiene 51 años, casado,  se dedica  a prestar servicio de amplificación y juego de luces, amenizando todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea bautizos matrimonios, fiestas de quince años,   todo esto en la localidad de Batallas,  con el dinero del crédito comprara  un teclado electrónico  para mejorara su amplificación, y así también  mejorar el servicio,  Sr. Hernán  se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio ya que le va muy bien sigue equipando su amplificación y de esta manera genera más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernán, 51, is married and works providing sound amplification and lighting displays for all sorts of events like baptisms, weddings, fifteen-year birthday parties, etc. in Batallas.  He will use the loan money to buy an electronic keyboard to improve sound amplification and provide better service too.  

Hernán feels very grateful for the opportunity being given to him to enlarge his business because he does very well.  He will continue improving sound amplification to generate more income for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy an electronic keyboard.

loans.name: G.s Los Angelitos Group

texts.es:
La  señora  Luz es una persona honesta y responsable vive con  sus  7 hijos y esposo en un municipio en la zona  sur de Honduras.Su negocio es compra y venta de gallinas y cerdos.
Doña Luz el préstamo lo necesita para surtir su negocio con una gran variedad de gallinas y cerdos. Con el préstamo espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más mercancía  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Doña Luz al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera  que  mejore un poco su estilo  de vida con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con extender su negocio a otros municipios en la zona y esa forma tener mayor cantidad de clientes que compren su producto  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien para la  sociedad.
Doña Sabina su negocio es la compra y  venta de gallinas y cerdos  desde hace 10  años. 
El joven Santos su negocio es la compra y venta de gallinas y cerdos  desde hace 6  años en la misma comunidad. 
.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Luz is an honest and responsible person who lives with her seven children and her husband in a city in the southern region of Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling chickens and pigs.  She needs this loan in order to stock her business with a great variety of these animals.  With the help of the loan she hopes to increase her sales, since she will have more merchandise to offer her customers who come to see her.  This will enable her to pay for her basic necessities.

Like the other members of this group, she hopes to be able to improve her standard of living a little bit with this investment.  She dreams of being able to expand her business to other cities in her area within a few years.  This would enable her to gain more customers who would purchase her goods.  This in turn would help her to continue supporting her children as they become good people who contribute to society.

Sabina has also had a business buying and selling chickens and pigs for ten years.  The young Santos has had a similar business for the last six years in the same community.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to purchase chickens for her business.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 5 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 25 juin 2002. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche. Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 3 garçons. 
Le prêt reçu va lui permettre de faire de l'embouche. Elle va acheter 2 bœufs à raison de 150 000f l'un pour revendre à 300 000f. Elle va profiter de l'hivernage pour engraisser les sujets.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer la dépense de la famille, de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants qui vont à l'école.
texts.en:
This group of five women is part of a banc villageois that was established on June 25, 2002. The group includes women who live in the same village and the surrounding area. They maintain good relationships and conduct business in trade and the fattening of cattle.

Fatou, standing at right in the photo with her hand raised, is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of 10 children, three of them boys. The loan received will allow her to fatten cattle. Fatou will purchase two steers for 150,000 CFA francs each, to be resold for 300,000 CFA francs. She will take advantage of the rainy season to fatten the steers.

With the profits, Fatou plans to assist with the family expenses and to take care of the school fees for her children who attend school.

loans.use: To purchase two steers.

loans.name: Elida Consuelo

texts.es: Elida de 36 años  de edad vive en casa propia con sus 5 hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración  y venta  de tortillas desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela  pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene  de sus venta  y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Elida  está solicitando un  crédito  para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir  con su trabajo y poder darle a familia  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elida is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and five children. She has been making and selling tortillas for three years. Elida has many customers since she is a hardworking and friendly individual. With the profit she earns from her sales, she is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses.

Elida is requesting a loan in order to buy corn in bulk and lime powder so that she can continue her work and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna, se decide por un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en la confección de prendas de vestir; esta inversión le ayudara  a comprar la materia prima, tales como: hilos, telas, agujas, entre otros artículos para llevar a cabo su actividad.
La Sra. Mirna con el crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener mayor clientela y con ello demanda en su negocio, tambien la  ventaja que posee con su negocio es que ella le confecciona a sus hijos la ropa.
texts.en:
Mirna decided to request a new loan so that she could continue her work of producing clothes. This investment will help her to buy raw materials such as thread, fabric, needles, and other items that she needs to carry out her work.

With the help of her previous loan, Sra. Mirna was able to obtain more customers and create more demand for her business. In addition, her business is advantageous since she is able to make clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Ghulzar

texts.en:
Ghulzar is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past three years, she has been running a business of clothing sales. She buys clothing of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from a wholesale market. Then she sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Ghulzar is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to buy a wider variety of clothes in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Ghulzar expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.
.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been selling clothes for many years. She buys a variety of embroidered and printed clothes from the city, then sells them in her community. She is well-known for her quality of goods.

Nasreen is applying for a 35,000 PKR loan through Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of clothes for the summer season according to the tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more through greater sales.

Nasreen wants to grow her business and dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children through all of her business efforts.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira, 21, is a hardworking young lady who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing so for the past two years and knows sewing techniques well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations, she is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through Kashf to buy threads in different colors and packets of zippers, buttons and ribbons. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of her profits on personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors and packets of zippers, buttons and ribbons

loans.name: Ndiack's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 personnes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été le 03 novembre 2009. Il est composé par de femmes qui habitent la même localité et ceux des alentours. Les membres vivent dans une bonne entente et sont solidaires entre elles. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Ndiack, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons. 
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter un bœuf à 150 000f et un mouton à 60 000f. Elle va les élever pour les revendre au bout de quelques mois. En parallèle elle va faire du commerce de mil, elle va acheter 2 sacs de mil à 15 000f pour revendre à 18 000f.
Les bénéfices lui permettent d'épargner et d'entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of two people is part of a banc villageois that was [established] on November 3, 2009. The group is made up of women who live in the same area. The group members live in harmony and support one another. Their primary businesses are trade and the fattening of livestock.

Ndiack, standing at right in the photo with her hand raised, is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children, four of them boys. With the loan received, she will purchase a steer for 150,000 CFA francs and a sheep for 60,000 CFA francs. She will raise them, then resell them after several months. Ndiack also sells millet. She will purchase two sacks of millet for 15,000 CFA francs to resell them for 18,000 CFA francs. The profits will allow Ndiack to save and to care for her children.

loans.use: To purchase one steer, one sheep, and millet.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora , está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gladys se dedica a la venta de comidas durante los fines de semana. Ha acondicionado un pequeño espacio en la vereda de su casa y ahí ofrece a la venta diferentes platos regionales, atiende siempre de manera amable y cordial a su distinguida clientela. Su actividad empieza levantándose muy temprano para realizar las compras de los ingredientes que usará en la preparación de las comidas. Ya  lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y de su nieta para atender al público. Considera que su trabajo es bastante rentable por la clientela constante que ha mantenido gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, asegura que es una actividad que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y eso le permite seguir adelante, desea que su trabajo permanezca estable para que continúe trabajando. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará víveres e ingredientes como arroz, pescados, condimentos, aceites, huevos y otros que necesita para la preparación de una mayor variedad de platillos.
texts.en: Gladys is an enterprising 42-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. The family lives in their own home. Gladys has a business selling food on the weekends. She has created a small space on the pavement in front of her house. From there she offers variety of regional dishes. She always tends to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner. She gets up very early to buy the ingredients that she uses in the preparation of her dishes. She has had this business for over 8 years. Her son and her niece help her to serve her customers. She believes that the business is fairly profitable, due to the steady client base she has maintained as a result of the good flavors of her food. She likes her business because it has brought her a great deal of satisfaction, both personally and financially. This is an activity that does not require a great deal of physical effort, and this allows her to keep going. She hopes that her business will remain stable so that she can continue working. She is currently seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles. She will use the proceeds to purchase supplies and ingredients such as rice, fish, eggs, oil and condiments so that she can prepare a greater variety of dishes. She is grateful for the loan opportunity so that she can have access to the credit she needs in order to continue toward her goals.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, fish, eggs, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en: Sadiqa, age 47, is a married woman. She has been running a business of hand-embroidery for the past 10 years. She is passionate about her work, and customer demand is strong. But business challenges and needed family expenditures frustrate her, nearly every day. Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 20,000. She will use the loan to buy raw materials in large quantities, including thread, sequins and pearls. These will enable her to complete the orders of her customers, on time. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market, to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in large quantities, including thread, sequins and pearls

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a married woman with four children, three attend school and one is still underage. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her children.

For the past two years, Hamadi has operated a rental house business. She rents houses to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges in the business are high cost and lack of enough cash to finish renovating the rental houses.

With the loan she is requesting, Hamadi wants to purchase more ceilings for her rental houses, to satisfy the needs of her clients. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ceilings for her rental houses, to satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida, 27 years old, has been involved in the business of sewing clothes for about three years. Very well known for her stitching techniques, her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, Zubaida has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000/- to buy a stock of threads, packs of zippers and buttons in various colors to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to meet personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads, packs of zippers and buttons in various colors

loans.name: Enkhtuul

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtuul is 45 years old and lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in house on plot of land. She has been selling clothes to Russians for thirteen years. She imports clothes in large quantity at lower price from China and later sells them at higher price. The gap between the prices becomes her income, which can hardly afford to sustain family needs. The house the family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, fiberglass, cements, foam and planks. Using those materials, She and her sons can repair and insulate their house, thereby creating a comfortable and warm place to live. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and release less pollutants therefore contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de hortalizas ejotes, tomates y güisquil desde hace 10 años, vende sus cosechas en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con su siembra y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in his parents’ house with his wife and daughter.  He is a farmer, and he has been growing beans, tomatoes, and ‘güisquil’ [a type of squash] for ten years.  He sells his harvests at the markets that are close to where he lives.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to pay for some of the household expenses.   

The client is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, and pest controls, etc. in order to continue with his planting and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Adama from Tombo, which is located in a rural area west of Freetown. She is married with two children aged two and eight years.

Adama started a palm oil business once she was married. She needed to make money to help support her family, so she started this venture after some training in running a business. She works ten hours a day, seven days a week. She says that her main challenge is the lack of enough money to run her business.

Adama is applying for a 500,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy extra palm oil to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and improve her living standards.

In the future Adama plans to continue expanding her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy extra palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Sindy Anabel

texts.es: La Sra. Sindy  tiene 21 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de San Jose,  es cliente nueva de la institución ya que es su primera secuencia, la Sra. Sindy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Sindy  es una persona joven  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y seguir mejorando en su actividad ya que hay mucha competencia pero esto hace que ella le ponga más empeño y trabajo a lo que ella le gusta que es elaborar pan para que llegue a toda la población donde ella vive .
texts.en:
Sra. Sindy is 21 years old. She produces and sells bread from her bakery that is located in the town of San Jose. Sindy is a new client of Emprender and this will be her first loan cycle. She will use the money to buy supplies such as flour, shortening, and yeast in bulk for making bread.

Sra. Sindy is a young person who has the drive to succeed. She is happy and pleased with the support that Emprender has provided. This business is her only means she has to support herself and to continue improving. She faces a great deal of competition, so she must put forth more effort and work. Sindy enjoys baking bread and would like to make it available to everyone in the town where she lives.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, and yeast in bulk.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 55 years old and a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 30,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, one of them attending school. He has worked as a car blacksmith and painter for over 18 years. He has two full-time male employees, helping him to get the work done. His wife works in parallel to supplement the family’s income. Her work is specialized in selling shoes.  They cooperate together to meet their life needs. 

Today, Ali is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase materials and equipment needed such as paint, brushes, metal, etc. He seeks to offer the best quality of services to his clients and he states that he is in a real need of acquiring these purchases to satisfy their demand. As for Ali’s future plans, he intends to expand his work into other areas where he will start to sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase materials (paint, brushes, metal) and equipment for car repair

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She is an expert in embroidery. She makes beautiful embroidery on clothes. Her clients are based in her community and from nearby areas. Kubra’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Currently she has applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 from Kashf Foundation for the further improvement of her business. With the loan she will buy cloth, beads, and embroidery threads in different colors that will allow her to fill her clients' orders on time and increase her profits. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy cloth, beads, and embroidery thread in different colors.

loans.name: Ansata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 21 décembre 2012 lors de son inauguration. Actuellement il est composé de 47 membres qui partagent un esprit de solidarité et d’entre aide sur tous les aspects de la vie.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Ansata  (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de deux filles. Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans le marché hebdomadaire de la sous région, par bidon de 20 litres pour la revente soit dans la capitale régionale, ou dans les autres régions par bouteille d’un litre ou par commande pour des commerçants revendeur dans les autres régions.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter deux à trois bidons pour la revente au détail par bouteille d’un litre.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales et le maintien de ses filles à l’école.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was established on December 21, 2012. The group currently has 47 members who share a spirit of solidarity and mutual assistance in every aspect of their lives. Their primary occupation is small business.

Mrs. Ansata (standing at far right [in the photo with her hand raised]) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of two girls. She sells palm oil, which she purchases at the weekly regional market in containers of 20 liters to resell in either the regional capital or other regions in one-liter bottles or to fill orders from resale merchants in other regions.

With her new loan, Mrs. Ansata will purchase two to three containers [of palm oil] to resell on the retail market in one-liter bottles. The profits will allow her to better assist her husband with the family expenses and to keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: To purchase two to three containers [of 20 liters of palm oil each] for retail sales in one-liter bottles.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen, 34, is married and has five children. She lives with her husband and children in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Her main business activity is farming rice on her own farmland with the help of her children. She has been doing this type of business for almost 20 years. 

Khen’s community is far away from the water distribution system of the province, so she dug a well in the past few years to supply the water to her household. The challenge she faces now is that the water from her well is not clear and safe enough to use any more because of mud at the bottom of the well. The water is vital to her family members, so she is borrowing a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to pay laborers for cleaning out her well and fixing the concrete rings, which are commonly used in Cambodia for water storage, wells and latrine pit linings. She hopes the loan will be granted to her to improve her family's water and sanitation.

loans.use: to pay laborers for cleaning out her well and fixing the concrete rings.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco  de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres  hijos de 2,6 y 11 años, el se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Francisco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 53 and lives in his own home with his wife and their three children aged 2, 6 and 11. He has grown sugar cane, corn and beans for over 30 years.  With his earnings from his sales he manages to cover his household expenses.  

He is seeking a loan in order to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.  This will enable him to continue with his planning and help him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a married 26-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and only child. He is the main income source of the family. He began working as a painter many years ago. Over the years, Hasan was able to build a good business reputation thanks to his talent and resourceful skills. 

Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase scaffolding. He notes that these will ease his business operations, especially when facing high ceilings. He benefited from two previous loans, and we note that he was an excellent client with punctual payments. Hasan is very ambitious and he intends to work harder so as to enhance the family’s way of living and help them meet their requirements.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding.

loans.name: Ágela Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “17 de Julio”.

En lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 52 años está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro de colegio.

Doña Ángela es una mujer muy buena y trabajadora que para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y joyas de  Romanel, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa, trabaja todos los días unas tres horas diarias, entrega sus productos a crédito  y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios.

Este crédito es para  comprar ropa, joyas y cosméticos para poder cumplir con los pedidos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el segundo ciclo y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han dado los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
In the City of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the “17 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks.

Angela lives here.  She is 52 years old, married, and has three adult children, one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband it a teacher.

Angela is a very good and hardworking person who sells clothing of all types, Yabnal brand products (beauty products and cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories) and Romanel jewelry in order to help with the household expenses.  She sells door to door and from her home, and works for about three hours a day.  She sells on credit, collects weekly, has been doing this for more than 10 years, and has benefited well.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, jewelry, and cosmetics to be able to meet her customer requests.  She has been in the communal bank since its second cycle and she enjoys it because of the help that the loans have provided.

Her dream is to move ahead with her business and family life.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Jorge, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar productos naturales como Omnilife, Ganocafé, Oxígeno líquido, ropa y calzado, que le solicitaron sus clientes. Con esta inversión pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo, sus ventas y sus utilidades, permitiéndole a su negocio crecer en los aspectos anteriores y en el número de sus clientes. Repercutiendo favorablemente en el bienestar de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en sus productos naturales, en ropa y calzado que le han solicitado sus clientes. Su objetivo es continuar aumentando el capital de trabajo. Jorge dice a sus financiadores: “Estoy muy agradecido con Kiva y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ya que he progresado mucho en mi negocio y en mis ingresos familiares”
texts.en:
Thank you for your support of Jorge, who with the help of his last Kiva loan was able to buy natural products such as Omnilife, Ganocafé, and Oxígeno Líquido, as well as clothing and footwear that his customers were asking for.  With this investment he was able to increase his inventory, his sales and his profits.  This enabled him to grow his business in these aspects as well as in the number of customers he serves.  This helped to improve his family's well-being.

He is currently seeking a new loan in order to continue to invest in his natural products, as well as in clothing and footwear which his clients have requested.  His goal is to continue to build his inventory.  He wishes to say to those who fund his loans: "I am very grateful to Kiva and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, since I have made a great deal of progress in my business and in my family income."

loans.use: to continue to invest in his natural products, as well as clothing and footwear which his clients have requested.

loans.name: Nazran

texts.en:
Nazran is a strong 26-year-old woman. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sells them to the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.

However, due to a lack of money Nazran is unable to meet the needs of her customers. For this reason she is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through Kashf Foundation. The loan will enable her to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packets of lace, zippers and buttons. In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses.

Nazran expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on bettering her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packets of lace, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Salamatu from Tombo western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, 15 years and 20 years old.  Her children are currently attending school. After the war, Salamatu established her home product business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support her household. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Salamatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is 58 years old and a married lady and is running a small general store in her community. She offers a variety of good quality products at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 25,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Maqsood wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime de 42 años vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 13, 18 y 23 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 10 años de su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 42 and lives in his own home with his wife and three children aged 13, 18 and 23.  His children are all currently studying.  He works as a farmer and grows corn and sorghum. He has done this work for 10 years of his life, and this is how he earns his living every day.  He is a hardworking and responsible man, and he is well-known in his area for his enormous heart and his friendly treatment of others.

Since it is the planting season, he has decided to start preparing himself.  For this reason he has chosen to seek a new loan from INTEGRA in order to invest in  fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.  What he wants most is to have an abundant harvest that is better than in previous years.  In this way he will continue to provide sustenance to his family.  He puts his faith in God, and with his help, along with his own effort and hard work, he will achieve his dream of providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
