texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hermana, el se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, desde hace 2 años, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, y por vender a buen precio sus productos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos y poder seguir con su trabajo y continuar  ayudando en los gastos de su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his parents and his sisters.  He has earned a living for two years raising and selling chickens.  He has a lot of customers because he's an honest, hardworking, and responsible person and because he sells his products for a good price.  With the profits from his sales he helps with the household expenses.

The client's requesting a loan to be able to buy more chickens and chicken feed so he can continue with his job and with helping pay the expenses without any limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy chicken and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José,  le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo para el cultivo de granos básicos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono y pago de mozos.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro cultivar una manzana de maíz y obtuvo una buena cosecha, asimismo genero ingresos para el hogar, es por ello que las condiciones económicas han mejorado y ha colocado un puesto  de venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
José finds it necessary to get a new loan because he needs more working capital for the planting of basic grains. This investment will help agricultural supplies such as pesticides, insecticides, manure, and other crop protection products, as well as to pay for labor.

The previous loan was beneficial for him as it allowed him to cultivate one manzana [1.74 acres] of corn and he had a good harvest. He also generated household income. This is why his financial situation has improved and he has set up a tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, insecticides, manure, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.en:
Adiba is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three. For many years she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread winner at the time. Eventually her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30000/-to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 5th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old married woman. For about three years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. She also knows the art of embellishing her designs by attaching gemstones with colorful threads. Her business allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue, she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy threads along with the packs of gemstones in different colors. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy thread along with packs of gemstones in different colors.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has owned a beauty parlor for about two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her services she has become very famous in her street. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested her third loan. She needs a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She desires to expand her business and wishes to utilize the earned revenue in improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isata from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years old. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Isata established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to survive. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is slow sales.

Isata requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton cloth. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business In the future; Isata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton cloth.

loans.name: Thelma Claribel

texts.es: Thelma de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz, sopas, café,  entre otras cosas, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda pero no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Thelma is 42 years old and is a single mother with two children aged 15 and 6 years. They are currently studying. Thelma is well known in the area where she lives for her modesty and devotion to her work. She has never let her problems defeat her and has always overcome her difficulties. Through hard work and dedication she has a shop where she sells items of basic needs such as dry grains, milk, eggs, rice, soups, coffee and other items. She is very committed to her work and very helpful when she is making sales, so she has customers who prefer to come to her for their products. 

Thelma sees a need to have some more stock for the shop because of the increased demand but she does not have the capital to do it. This is why she is asking for a loan to buy more products such as dry grains, instant food, sweets, drinks etc. She trusts in God that she will soon be given the help she is asking for and she will not have to worry about providing the daily necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, instant food, sweets, drinks etc.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 39 years old, married, and blessed with four children. 

Mwanamisi operates a beauty shop that has been there for four years now. She is employed somewhere else and she decided to employ someone to manage the business on her behalf. She has a vision of owning a large boutique in the next five years. 

She knew Milango Financial Services through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy synthetic hair and lotions to sell. The business has been doing great, despite the high costs of transport and the low season. The income from the loan use will pay school fees for her children and will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair and lotions.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila, es una persona casada y disfruta de una hija de 18 años de edad, no recibe ayuda del extranjero.  Ella, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y dulces, dicha actividad la realiza como sustento para su familia y lo realiza de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de productos, tales como: lápiz labial, lociones, rubores, polvos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus ventas y aumentar la clientela.
La Sra. Bertila sueña con ofrecerle  ayuda  a su hija para que estudie una profesión universitaria.
texts.en:
Bertila is married and has an 18-year-old daughter. She does not receive assistance from abroad. Bertila sells beauty products and sweets. She says that her business enables her to sustain her family. She works from 7:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a variety of products such as lip pencils, lotions, blush, powders, and other items. This investment will help to improve her sales and increase her clientele. Sra. Bertila dreams of helping her daughter so that she can study at the university in order to pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, lotions, blush, powders, and other items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys appreciates the Kiva loan she received previously that enabled her to generate profits in her business.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase cereals, such as rice, beans, and maize for her business.

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, such as rice, beans, and maize for her business.

loans.name: Sunkarie

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sunkarie from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 6 and 11 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Sunkarie established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the  purchasing power of customers is very slow.

Sunkarie requires a loan in order to buy tooth paste, soap and body cream for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Sunkarie plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy tooth paste, soap and body cream for resale

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal, 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. She has been teaching for thirteen years at a high school where she also graduated. Besides being a teacher, she also makes and sells needlework to local people. Her husband breeds cattle in the countryside and runs a cafeteria. She is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to purchase an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The automobile will be used for transportation. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Gbassay from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2007, Gbassay established her home product business. She began her business because she wants to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the purchasing power of customers is very slow.

Gbassay requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Gbassay plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 35 years old and married with 1 child who is 3 years old. She runs a retail business in Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She began this business to generate a source of income to support her home.

She hsa been in this business for 10 years, and she sells pan sets, tooth paste, body creams and hair relaxers within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase set pans, tooth pastes, body creams and hair relaxers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her standard of living. In the future, she would like to have a permanent business location. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy pan sets, tooth paste, body creams and hair relaxers for resale

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 20-year-old single Palestinian man, who has been working in providing internet and computer services to his Palestinian camp citizens.
His work is going on just fine, but he needs an extra external push to improve and develop his business. That is why Moustafa is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua so he can update his business tools and machines and increase the number of his computers to increase his business income.
Moustafa is very excited for this loan and is investing a lot of hope in it because it is the only way for him to develop his work, especially since the Palestinians have limited access to jobs.
He hopes that one day he can move his business outside of the camp to improve his income and living.

loans.use: To update his business tools and machines, and to increase the number of his computers to increase his business income

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys lives in Kongowea area. She operates a retail shop from where she lives. She has had a Kiva loan before which she paid back without challenges. She is asking for another loan to buy additional retail stock of paraffin, flour and soap for sale. She also owns a farm which produces some products that she sells to earn an income. She has been running the business for the last three years. She hopes that the business grows into a wholesale in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items, such as paraffin, flour and soap, to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 30 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 2 and 13 years. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. Two of her children are going to school.

Mariatu's been in this business since 2008 and she sells a variety of food containers in her community. She says that the main problem with her business is improper business location.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to buy more plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 32 year old Hawa from Liberia.  Presently, she lives in the Gardnersville area, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single, and has three children between eight and 17 years old.  She was not fortunate enough to attend school.   

For the past eight years now, she has been operating a table at which she sells palm oil in the local market. She spends ten hours a day on her business six days a week.  She likes her business because she has many customers and makes lots of profit, and because she started this business with money given to her by her mother. Mostly, she uses a taxi to have her goods at her table.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build her own house and become an international business woman.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Isatu, from Tombo, in the Western Area Rural, Freetown. She is married and has three children, between the ages of 8 and 18 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. Isatu started a business after her wedding, when she began selling groundnuts (peanuts) alongside the village road. She began her business, because she wanted to create a source of income to take care of her needs.  She says that the main challenge to her business is her lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan, in order to buy more bags of groundnuts to resell at the roadside. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, and improve her standard of living. In the future, Isatu plans to expand the business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts to resell

loans.name: Dominga Isabel

texts.es: Dominga de 41 años de edad desde hace 18 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 14 y 13 años de edad. Junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar un crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible, ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plaga,  etc. así como muestra la fotografía para seguir con  la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Dominga is 41-years old.  For the last 18 years she has made her living cultivating the land.  With a lot of dedication she grows corn and beans, which allows her to meet the basic needs of her household.  Dominga is known for being a hard-working, honest and responsible woman.  She lives with her family, which is made up of her husband and their four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 13-years old respectively.  She and her husband work very hard to get their family ahead and give them better conditions than they had.  Thanks to knowing how to farm, they have been able to support their household.  It is the only way the know to make an honest living.  Because she has a great desire to improve her situation, Dominga came to the Institution to request a loan.  The planting season has begun and she needs to start planting as soon as possible.  She needs to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizer, herbicide, pest control etc., as the above photo shows, to continue with the planting.  Dominga trusts in God and in her work that she will have an abundant harvest, which will allow her to access a better quality of life her herself and for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, herbicide, pest control etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de plátanos y la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz desde hace 7 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de las cosechas y plátanos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Juan  está solicitando un crédito especialmente para la siembra y poder comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y asi continuar con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan lives in a house that he owns with his wife and five-year-old son.  He makes a living selling bananas and farming.  His principal crop is corn, which he has been growing for seven years.  When the harvest is ready, he stores the corn in sacks, as shown in the photo.  He later leaves to sell his harvest items at the different markets that are located close to where he lives.  With the profits he makes from his harvest sales and from the bananas, he can cover some home expenses.

Juan is requesting a loan for his crop.  He will buy some necessary farming supplies, like fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc.  He will thereby be able to continue with his crops and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and married. She has two children, aged 4 and 10 years. She runs a business, hawking goods in Tombo, Western Area Rural, Sierra Leone. She's been in this business since 2009, and she sells baskets, cups, and a variety of food containers, to members of her community.  She says that the main problem of her business is an unfavorable business location.

Nancy requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone, which she will use to buy more plates and a variety of food containers to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plates and a variety of food containers to resell

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Absheron region with his family. Azad is 32 years old, married, and has two sons. His 8-year-old son goes to school, and his 5-year-old son goes to preschool. 

Azad started his business two years ago, raising calves. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy calves. He wants to use the money for his family's future. 

In the future, Azad wants to repair his farm; this will be more profitable for his business. Azad is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Maseray is 40 years old and married with three children, ages 6 and 17. She runs a fish business in Tombo, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to make a daily living. 

She got in this business just after she got married, and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, she has insufficient capital to run her business.

Maseray requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more fish to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business, and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to become a fish supplier. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don Mario de 45 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 17, 12, 12 y  8 años de edad y uno de 9 meses, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 27 años, comercializa sus productos en las agencias den compra-venta de granos básicos,  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Mario está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc.  Para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario, 45, lives in his own house with his wife and his five children, ages 17, 12, 12, 8, and 9 months.  He has earned a living for 27 years growing corn and millet.  He sells his crops to the distributors that buy and sell basic grains.

With the profits from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Mario's requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, seed, herbicide, etc., so he can continue with his crop and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, seed, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Yamila Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yamila , es una señora preocupada por el aprendizaje de los demás, como profesión  docente  maestra de primaria profesional al servicio de un centro de Educación de la zona donde habita desde hace 16 años, es soltera, tiene  un  niño a su cargo.    

Actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción tales como  cemento, zinc, arena, hierro, bloques, perlines, piedrín y pago de mano de obra. 

Y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando  mejoras en su vivienda, por lo tanto le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno para realizar sus sueños, de esas manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Yamila’s a woman who is concerned about others’ learning.  She’s a primary school teacher by profession and works at a local school in the community where she’s lived for the last 16 years.  She’s single and has a boy in her care.

She’s currently asking for a small loan to make home improvements and to buy building supplies like cement, metal sheeting, iron rods, roofing purlins, gravel and to pay labor costs.

In this way she will improve her living conditions because she’s been making these home improvements with much effort.  She’s grateful to Ceprodel for the timely support for her to reach her dreams thus improving her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.pt:
Lalita nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, na Província de Maputo. Tem 29 anos e é mãe de 1 filho que vai à escola. Vive com a sua família numa casa alugada.
Trabalha no processamento de água mineral como engarrafadora há mais de 7 anos. Com o valor solicitado pretende comprar material de construção como cimento, blocos, ferro e barrotes para dar inicio à obra de construção da sua casa. Este é seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
O seu maior sonho é concluir uma parte da sua obra e mudar-se para lá o mais rápido possível e sair da casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Lalita comes from the district of Namaacha, province of Maputo. She's 29 years old and has a son who attends school. She lives with her family in a rented house.
She has worked in water processing as a bottler for over seven years. With the requested amount she intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, iron and beams so she can begin to build her house. This is her first loan with Hluvuku.
Her biggest dream is to finish part of the construction work in order to move in as soon as possible and move out of the rental house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, iron and beams so she can begin to build her house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Please meet Victoria, aged 48, from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Victoria completed 9th grade, and she is married.   She has seven children between the ages of 9 and 33 years.  Only five of her children are in school, and they all live at home.
 
Victoria has owned a table business for the past four years, selling foods including chickens' feet and pigs' feet.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more of these foods to sell.
  
On average, she works 9 hours per day at her business.  She started her business with money she got from her husband. She transports her goods by taxi.  She cites as her biggest business challenge, "too few goods."  Her favorite part of her business is the profit.  In the future, she would like to build a shop. She thanks you, in advance, for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more of the foods that she sells at her table, including chickens' feet and pigs' feet

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Annie from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past the free-port.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country, and is known for their fresh fish as it is located by the ocean.  However, it is also one of the poorer areas and housing quality is often very low. 

She is living with her fiance and two children.  Her oldest child is 10 and her  younger child is 2. They live at home, and the older child goes to school.
 
Annie has a table from which she sells soft drinks.  She has been in business for nine years and works eight hours; she transports her goods by taxi, and started her business with money from her fiancé.  

With this loan, she will buy soft drinks.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is insufficient income.   

She is proud of her business because she makes a profit. Her plan is to build a house.  

She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona, tiene tres hijos a los cuales ayuda en sus estudios y alimentación, tiene problemas con su concubino, la señora Petrona trabaja en la agricultura hace 15 años, se dedica a la cría de ganado de engorde y ganado porcino,  para  ello necesita mucha ayuda económica es por eso que solicita préstamo para compra de alimento balanceado porcino, actualmente vive con sus tres hijos, Dña. Petrona no pudo continuar con sus estudios por motivo de que sus padres tenían problemas económicos en esa época, solo le quedaba trabajar para salir adelante,  Pero la señora Petrona necesita ayuda para subsistir y tener un futuro próspero es una persona responsable trabajadora indican sus vecinos y amigos de la zona.
texts.en: Petrona has three children whom she helps with their schooling and food, she has problems with her domestic partner. Petrona has been farming for 15 years, raising cattle and pigs. In order to do this she needs economic help therefore she seeks a loan to buy balanced pig feed. Today she lives with her three children. Petrona couldn't continue with her education because her parents had economic difficulties, so she could only work in order to become successful. But Petrona needs help to survive and have a prosperous future. Her neighbors and friends in her neighborhood say she is a responsible hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his family group consisting of his life companion and their two daughters.  He’s been working in agriculture for six years growing corn and beans.  He sells his crops in surrounding areas of his home and uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.

He’s asking Integral for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure, herbicide, tools, etc.  He has good payment references and assures that he’ll be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that he’ll bring economic security home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, tools, etc.

loans.name: Salomao

texts.pt:
Salomao, de 54 anos é docente há 34 anos e possui 7 filhos dos quais 4 vivem com ele com as seguintes idades 25, 22, 18 e 13 anos, e frequentam o 1º ano da faculdade, e os 2 estudam 8a classe.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de material de construção como pedra e areia para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
Salomão tem a esperança de concluir a sua obra e ter fundos para garantir estudos dos seus filhos. O principal desafio é de concluir a sua obra e comprar mobília.
texts.en:
Salomão is 54 years old and has been a teacher for 34 years. He has seven children, four of whom live with him and are 25, 22, 18 and 13 years old. They attend their first year of college and two of them attend 8th grade.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies such as rocks and sand so he can continue building his house.
Salomão hopes to finish the construction work and have enough funds to ensure his children's education. His main challenge is finishing the construction work and buying furniture.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as rocks and sand so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa   cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de variedad de ropa por mayor,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de chamarras y chompas ya que tiene mucha demanda ya que se acerca la época de frio, se siente feliz y agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que le permiten crecer en su actividad.
texts.en: Mariana continues with the same activity of selling clothes.  She relates that she did well with the previous loan in that she used it to buy a variety of clothing at wholesale.  On this occasion she requests the loan to buy jackets and sweaters since they are in high demand because the cold season is approaching.  She feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because they make her business growth possible.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and jackets at wholesale.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 26 años, es un joven soltero y sin hijos por el momento que vive en su casa propia hecha de madera, el cual construyó en un terreno que le dierón sus padres. Cesar se dedica a la agricultura fue gracias a sus padres que aprendió a trabajar en el campo brindándole todo el cuidado necesario a sus plantaciones. Lleva 6 años en está actividad y se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que puede obtener buenos ingresos al final de la campaña y así ahorrar y solventar sus gastos personales. Siempre trata de mantener en buen estado la calidad de sus plantaciones fertilizando sus terrenos con abono orgánico para mantener la naturaleza de sus terrenos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir invirtiendo en sus terrenos. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para comprar abono orgánico al por mayor y fertilizar sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Cesar, 26, is a young single man with no children at the moment living in his own house made of wood that he built on a lot his parents gave him.  Cesar works in agriculture.  

It was thanks to his parents that he learned to work in the field providing all necessary care to his plants.  He’s been in this occupation for six years and feels very good with his work because he’s able to earn good income at the end of the season thus saving and covering his personal expenses.  He always tries to keep his plants in good condition fertilizing his land with organic manure to maintain the nature of his fields.


This is his 4th Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to count on the necessary trust to continue investing in his land.  On this occasion he wants to have 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure at wholesale and fertilize his parcels of land.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva continua participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y con el negocio de venta de comestibles, ella continua con la tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde expende sus productos. 

Primitiva agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar mercadería que necesitaba entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más.
 
Primitiva nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Primitiva tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Primitiva continues participating in the “Virgen de Chanca” communal bank; her business is selling groceries.  She continues with her home-based grocery store where she sells her goods.

Primitiva is infinitely grateful to all the lenders that supported her in her previous loan because she did very well and was able to buy the merchandise she needed then.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil and other things.

Primitiva was born in Challabamba District and still lives in the same district of her birth. (Challabamba District is located in Paucartambo Province in Cusco Department, Perú).  Primitiva is 40-years-old, married and has had three children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Miriam Laura

texts.es:
Mirian Laura continúa participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” y con el negocio de venta de productos nutricionales pues es distribuidora mayorista. Ella también es profesora y trabaja en uno de los colegios de la ciudad de Challabamba. Ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar la mercadería que necesitaba entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos nutricionales o energéticos.

Ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam Laura is still a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Chanca” and continues with her business selling wholesale nutritional and energy products.  She is also a teacher and works in one of the high schools in Challabamba.  Miriam is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported her with her previous loan.  It went very well for her.  She was able to purchase the merchandise she needed.  At this time, she needs the loan to purchase more nutritional and energy products. 

Miriam Laura was born in Challabamba District and still lives there today.  (The Challabamba District is located in the Paucartambo Province of Cusco Department, Perú).  She is 32-years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has two children.

loans.use: to purchase more nutritional and energy products.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila de 47 años, es una mujer casada con Edilberto y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella en una casa construida a base de adobe. Su actividad principal es la agricultura que desempeña en un terreno de 2 hectáreas que compró junto a su esposo en una localidad cercana a su hogar. Se inició en esta labor hace mas de 15 años con el objetivo de conseguir ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, siembra algunos productos típicos de la zona como cacao orgánico, café y cítricos. Todos los días trabaja en sus parcelas con el único objetivo de brindarle un mantenimiento adecuado para obtener al término de la campaña productiva de buena calidad. Aparte de contar con el apoyo de su esposo contrata en varias ocasiones a trabajadores del lugar que le ayudan a realizar las tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y traslado de sacos con los granos secos de cacao. Tiene pensado realizar algunas mejoras en sus parcelas tales como el reemplazo de varios árboles de cacao que están malogrados y ya no pueden dar frutos de calidad. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es construir su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos es por ello que siempre esta muy motivada. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas almácigo y tenerlos listos para colocarlos en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Cirila, 47, is a woman married to Edilberto and she has three children living with her in a house built of adobe.  Her main activity is agriculture that she carries out on a two-hectare parcel she bought with her husband in a locality near home.  She started in this activity more than 15 years ago with the objective of earning income to support her children and to plant some products like organic cocoa beans, coffee and citrus fruit that are typical of the zone.

She works on her land every day with the only objective of providing adequate maintenance so that a good quality crop yield will be obtained at the end of the season.  In addition to her husband’s help she often hires local laborers to help her do the complicated chores like weeding and transporting the sacks of dry cocoa beans.

She’s thinking about making some improvements on her parcels like replacing several cacao trees that are damaged and no longer able to produce quality fruit.  One of her main long-term goals is to build her house out of substantial materials hoping to improve her quality of life and that of her children; this is what keeps her motivated always.

This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  

On this occasion she wants to have 1,000 new soles to buy seedling plants to have ready to place in her crops.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Aventina

texts.pt:
Aventina tem 46 anos de idade, é viuva mãe de 3 filhos já maiores de idade. Ela é negociante e tem sua loja na sua casa.
Com o valor deste crédito quer comprar açúcar, arroz, cebola, refrescos, para a sua loja. 
No futuro diz que tem sonho de fazer aviários para criação de frangos para vender de modo a reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que gosta da maneira como é tratada na Hluvuku, pois o crédito e flexίivel e o cliente é que determina o valor a pagar mensalmente. Diz ainda que irá pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar outro crédito para poder realizar seu sonho.
texts.en:
Aventina is 46 years old and a widow. She has three children who are already adults. She's a trader and runs a store in her house.
With the amount from this loan she wishes to purchase sugar, rice, onions and refreshments for her store.
She states that her dream for the future is to build an aviary so she can raise chickens for selling in order to increase her family's income.
She states that she enjoys the way she's treated at Hluvuku, because the loans are flexible and the client gets to decide how much will be repaid monthly. She also states that she'll make her repayments in a timely fashion and request another loan again so she can achieve her dream.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, onions and refreshments for her store.

loans.name: Zoila Reyna

texts.es: Doña Zoila de 41 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus dos hijos y tres nietos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 10 años, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Zoila ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  Para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zoila, 41, lives in her own house with her husband, her two children and three grandchildren.  She’s been growing corn for ten years.  This is how she makes a living and is able to provide daily bread at home and the only way she knows to earn a living.  She does agricultural activities year to year and uses profits earned from her sales to cover some of her household expenses.

Zoila has made the decision to request a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies: manure, pest poison, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. to continue planting and to be able to give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ana Elba

texts.es: Ana vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13, 10 y 9 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra ella y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and three children aged 13, 10 and 9 in her own house but does not have electricity.  She works selling sweet bread from place to place in neighborhoods near her place of residence.  With profits earned from her sales she’s able to cover some of her household expenses.

Ana’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because she’s unable to do so with what they earn.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels in the shape of a lamp that’s useful for houses in rural zones that don’t have electricity.  With this purchase, she and her family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have light of their own at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 32 años de edad , está casado con Karina con quien vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Cesar se dedica a la agricultura y se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador actualmente tiene un terreno agrícola de 4 héctareas en las afueras de la ciudad , en donde tiene plantaciones de cacao.
Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de su esposa quien lo apoya directamente en el trabajo que realiza en sus cultivos. Para agilizar las labores  que realiza cuenta con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar. Una de las prioridades que tiene en cada campaña es de contar con el dinero necesario para pagarle a los trabajadores y comprar abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos. Hasta el momento tiene un objetivo bien fijado y es poner una tienda de comestibles con el fin de ayudar a su esposa. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
César, 32, is married to Karina.  He lives with her in his own house made of wood.

César earns a living in agriculture.  He's known as a very hardworking man.  Currently he has four hectares of farmland on the outskirts of town where he has cacao fields.

He always has the support of his wife, who helps him directly with his work on his crops.  To speed up the work he has the help of laborers in the area.  One of his priorities every season is to have the necessary money to pay the workers and buy organic soil amendments to nourish his fields.  Up to now he has a very fixed goal, to set up a grocery store to help his wife.

This is his second Kiva loan and he's grateful for the financial support to get ahead.  He also promises to make his payments punctually.

Currently he wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: David

texts.es: David de 31 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, trabaja de empleado en una alcaldía cerca de su lugar de residencia también posee una pequeña parcela donde siembra maíz,  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, David está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
David, 31, lives with his life partner in their own house but he doesn't have electricity. He is an employee in the mayor's office near his place of residence. He also has a small piece of land where he grows corn. With his earnings from crop sales and from his job he is able to pay some household expenses. 

David is requesting a loan for the purchase of a solar lamp since no one in the community where he resides has electricity and with what he earns it's not enough. The lamp is a charging station with solar panel energy in a lamp form that is used for homes in rural areas where there is no electricity. 

With this purchase it will benefit his family and at night they will be able to have their own light.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es: Eladio de 59 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años su principal siembra es el maíz y el ajonjolí sus hijos mayores le ayudan en la siembra, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Eladio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Eladio, 59, lives with his wife and six children in his own house but does not have electricity.  He’s worked in agriculture for 20 years and his main crops are corn and sesame.  His older children help him with the crops and he uses profits earned from his sales to cover some of his household expenses.

Eladio’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because the community he lives in nobody has electricity and what he earns is insufficient to do so.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels shaped like a lamp that’s useful for homes in rural zones that don’t have electric power.  With this purchase the family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo de 64 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 10 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Eliseo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Eliseo, 64, lives with his life companion and ten-year-old son in his own house but does not have electricity.  He works in agriculture and his main crop is corn.  He uses profits earned from his sales to cover some of his household expenses.

Eliseo’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because what he earns is insufficient to do so.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels shaped like a lamp that’s useful for homes in rural zones that don’t have electric power.  With this purchase the family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana continúa con los negocios de venta de frutas, ganadería y agricultura, ella vende frutas de las más populares que crecen por la zona Challabamba que son las manzanas y los duraznos. 

Ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar la mercadería que necesitaba entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas como por ejemplo manzanas. 

Ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Ella continúa participando en el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues tiene una buena relación con sus demás compañeras.
texts.en:
Sebastiana continues with the fruit selling, animal husbandry and agriculture business.  She sells the most popular fruit that grows around the Challabamba zone which are apples and peaches.

She’s infinitely grateful to all the lenders that supported her in her previous loan because she did very well and was able to buy more merchandise she needed.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more fruit like apples, for example.

She was born in Challabamba District and still lives there.  (Challabamba District is located in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Perú).  She’s 30-years-old and in a common law relationship; she has three children.  She continues participating in the “Virgen de Chanca” communal bank because she has a good relationship with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as apples to sell.

loans.name: Vilma De La Cruz

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 43 años de edad y vive con una nieta, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya están casados. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas y dicha actividad la desempeña todos los días, lo posee desde hace dos años, oficio que lo aprendió con una tía.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima, tales como: carnes, harina, gas, quesillo, condimentos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
La Sra. Vilma sueña con fortalecer más el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vima, 43, lives with her granddaughter.  All her children are adults and already married.  She earns a living making pupusas [stuffed tortillas] every day.  She has had this business for two years; she learned it from an aunt.

The loan she's requesting will allow her to buy meat, flour, gas, cheese, condiments, and other ingredients.  This investment will help her increase her supplies and earn more income.

Vilma dreams of strengthening her business more and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, gas, cheese, condiments, and other ingredients

loans.name: Artsruni

texts.en:
Artsruni lives in the city of Vedi with his retired mother, wife and two children. Artsruni has taken part in war on behalf of today’s Independent Republic of Nagorni Karabakh, a war that was long and very severe. He fought with a great belief in God and endless love for his motherland but became disabled, suffering a wound in which he lost his left wrist.

Despite the difficulties of his life, Artsruni is engaged in farming, breeding two cows and selling the farm products (cheese, milk and meat) at their local markets. A strong-willed person who alone manages to take care of his family members, he is requesting a loan of 400.000 Armenian drams to buy more cattle for his farm to enlarge his farm activities.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his farm to increase his family's income

loans.name: Hugo Rafael

texts.es: Hugo de 39 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 7 meses en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él trabaja de ayudante en un camión que realiza viajes a los diferentes lugares que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con el pago que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Hugo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él  y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Hugo, 39, lives with his life companion and seven-month-old daughter in his own house but does not have electricity.  He works as an assistant on a bus that makes trips to various places near his place of residence.  He uses his salary earned to cover some of his household expenses.

Hugo’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because what he earns is insufficient to do so.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels shaped like a lamp that’s useful for homes in rural zones that don’t have electric power.  With this purchase the family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 34 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica,   el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarla, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrá beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
José, 34, lives with his life companion and two children who are 7 and 5 years of age in his own house but does not have electricity.  He works in agriculture especially growing corn and beans.  He uses profits earned from his sales to cover some of his household expenses.

José’s asking for a loan to buy a solar lamp because nobody in the community he lives in has electricity and what he earns is insufficient to do so.  The lamp is a charging station with solar panels shaped like a lamp that’s useful for homes in rural zones that don’t have electric power.  With this purchase the family will be benefited because they’ll be able to have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Francisco Vicente

texts.es:
Francisco continúa dictando clases en un colegio de la ciudad de Challabamba y también sigue con el negocio de crianza de pollos. Ya son tres años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero siempre necesita capital para comprar mercadería entonces una vecina le invitó a participar del banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”. 

Francisco agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar animales menores entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos.

Francisco nació en el distrito de Paucartambo pero vive en Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba y Paucartambo están ubicados en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 55 años de edad, tiene una relación libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Francisco continues teaching classes in a school in the city of Challabamba. He also continues in the business of raising chickens. He has had this business for three years now and it is going very well for him but he always needs capital to buy merchandise so a neighbour asked him to participate in the communal bank “Virgen de Chanca." 

Francisco is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported him with the previous loan because it went very well and he could buy smaller animals. At this time he needs a loan to buy more chickens.

Francisco was born in the district of Paucartambo but lives in Challabamba. (The district of Challabamba and Paucartambo are located in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru). He is 55 years old and is in a common law marriage, from which he has three children.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk became the only breadwinner in his family after he got married and started to live separately from his parents. He earns his living by providing a taxi service in Gyumri town where he lives. 

Manuk is young, but already very skilled in driving a taxi. He knows each place in his town, so the customers value the service Manuk provides.

Manuk has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Manuk has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Manuk to renovate the car and purchase tires so he will be able to continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the taxi and purchase tires.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis labora desde hace varios años en agricultura, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de café, él le da el  mantenimiento necesario a  su cafeto para abtener una buena cosecha y un producto de calidad, necesita comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbicidas, fungicidas y otros agroquímicos, para esto solicita doscientos setenta y cinco mil colones (¢275.000), igualmente Jorge Luis agradece el apoyo financiero comunal que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis has worked in agriculture for several years. He makes his living planting and harvesting coffee. He gives his coffee plants the necessary care to have a good harvest and a quality product. 

He needs to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides, and other agro-chemicals. To do this he is requesting a loan of 275,000 colones. Jorge Luis appreciates the communal financial support that he has been offered.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

Fatmata, who is in her late twenties, is from Tombo, a rural area in western Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She started her business in order to take care of her children.

Fatmata runs a food stand business from her home. She sells rice, tomato paste, and seasoning. She has been running this business since the rebel war ended. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Fatmata's main business challenge is price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Fatmata is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store, including soda, onions, and seasoning. The extra income she will earn as a result of this loan will allow her to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including soda, onions, and seasoning.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta continua con el negocio de venta de cosméticos y participando con el banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca”. 

Maria Antonieta agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y pudo comprar la mercadería que necesitaba entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para continuar comprando mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, colonias, aretes, cremas, pinta labios y otras cosas más.

Maria Antonieta nació en el distrito de Cusco pero ahora vive en el distrito de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta continues selling cosmetics and participating in the communal bank “Virgen de Chanca.” Maria Antonieta is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported her with her previous loan because it went very well and she could buy the merchandise she needed. 

At this time she needs a loan to continue buying merchandise such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks etc...

Maria Antonieta was born in the district of Cusco but now lives in the district of Challabamba. (The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo in Cusco, Peru). 

She is 45 years old, married and has four children; fruits of this beautiful relationship

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, earrings, creams, lipsticks etc...

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Wara from Tombo, Western rural area in Freetown. She is a married mother and blessed with three children between the ages of 10 years and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. She also has one of her relatives helping her to prepare the cookery.

Wara runs a cookery business at home; she sells rice and pure water. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. Wara says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes if the food is not finished, she will run at a loss.

Wara has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. 

In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy uniform material.

loans.name: Rimaz 1 Group

texts.en:
Nour El Huda is the featured borrower of Rimaz 1 group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Nour El Huda is a 29-year-old married mother of two children. She is a Syrian citizen living and working in Lebanon since she got married. She has been working selling clothes at her house for five years. Her work is improving, but she needs additional external support. That's why she is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection.

She is the first from the left wearing green. As for the other group members, Samira is the first from the right, and Ibtisam is the one wearing yellow.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new clothes collection.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is an 18-year-old single man who has been providing Internet services to his villagers since four years ago. He was only fourteen years old when he started his own business, to help his parents in their living. He is the sole breadwinner in his family, and is responsible for the living of two persons in his family.

Imad is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to update his Internet network in order to keep his customers pleased and satisfied. He also provides hookahs for his customers as an additional income, in addition to a pool table, which diversifies the business for the customers’ needs and requests.

Imad hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to update his Internet network, in order to keep his customers pleased and satisfied.

loans.name: Alfrida B.

texts.en:
Alfrida B. is 46 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a high school dropout, and she is married with four children between the ages of 13 and 30; only two live at home and are attending school.

Alfrida has been selling used clothes for the past four years, and she is a very successful businesswoman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her generate more profit to send her children to school.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business; she plans to send her children to the university in the near future. She thanks BRAC for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family used to live in a rental apartment. She has been running a pay toilet business at a bus station for five years. Her husband renders taxi service to local people for a living. Using her previous loan, she purchased a new automobile for her husband as the old one had become obsolete. This time she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to repair and insulate her recently purchased old house. After renovation, she and her family can live in a comfortable and warmer place without worrying about incoming winter. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release fewer pollutants into the air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Gulmaya

texts.en:
Gulmaya lives in the Absheron region with her family. She is 36 years old and has a child. She is looking after the child alone. 

Gulmaya started a café business seven months ago. Now she needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy tables and chairs for the café. 

In the future, she wants to use the profit to pay for her child's education, and also wants to repair her cafe. This will be more profitable for her business. 

She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her café.

loans.name: San Ignacio  De Colón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Los Ángeles en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias y 1 socio del Banco Comunal San Ignacio De Colon. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, al comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellas hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y su vida familiar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Laura, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12 y de 10 años que  estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es subcontratista en reparaciones de tuberías de agua.

Doña Laura es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta ganar su propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar y en especial los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, ella tiene un negocio muy variado en un local en su casa, allí  vende medicinas, productos de bazar y papelería, además de esto ella es artesana, realiza arreglos en carros alegóricos en diversidad de detalles y formas, hace trajes típicos hechos en material reciclable.  Esto le deja muy buenos ingresos ya que tiene muchos contratos  de instituciones o personas particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realiza, ella lleva con sus actividades más de 9 años y le encanta lo que hace. 

Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares que es lo que más necesita actualmente para surtir su negocio. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que estos le ayudan en su negocio. 

Sus sueños son mejorar cada día y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 11 female members and one male member of the San Ignacio De Colon communal bank meet in the area known as Los Ángeles in the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo every 15 days.  They work at different business activities like farming, general commerce, and providing services, among other things.  Some time ago they decided to unite and form this communal bank, which has helped a lot in their businesses and family life.

Laura, age 40, is one of the members of this group.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has two children, ages 12 and 10.  The children attend primary and secondary school.  Her husband is a subcontractor, and he works repairing water pipes. 

Laura is an very enterprising woman who likes to earn her own income with which she helps her husband pay the household expenses, especially the children’s educational expenses.  She has a very diverse business in her house.  She sells medicine, household products, and stationery items.  She is also an artisan.  She makes arrangements in different designs and shapes to decorate floats.  She makes typical clothing from recyclable material.  This leaves her with good earnings because she has a lot of contracts with institutions or private people who know about the good work that she does.  She has been involved with her business activities for over nine years.  She loves what she does.

This loan it to buy school supplies, which is what she currently needs the most now in order to stock her business.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She likes it because of the loans.  These help her in her business.

Her dreams are to improve every day and to give her children the best.

The small photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and married with two children, ages 6 years and 12 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, in the western rural area of Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2000 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, she is facing insufficient capital to run her business.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she would like to become an agent of Fishing Company. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 30-year-old business woman from Liberia. She and her fiancée are living together; they both have two children, aged 8 and 10. Her two children are currently attending school and live at home.  She had completed fifth grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a working woman.

She lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Patience has a cook shop (restaurant) which has been selling rice and soup for the past three years now. She works ten hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is that sometimes customers complain about the high price of food. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more food ingredients, such as dried bush-meat, fish, pepper, onions, Vita (juice drink), salt, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day own a house.  

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients, such as dried bush-meat, fish, pepper, onions, Vita, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry business.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is 40-year-old Mamusu from Tombo, in the western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with eight children between the ages of 10 months and 22 years.  

Mamusu runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since after the war. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Mamusu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Mamusu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to change her business to a gari (cassava flakes) and palm oil seller. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet and his family live in Vanadzor City in the Lori region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, two children and retired mother in their private house. 

Hamlet runs his fruit and vegetable trading business from a rented stall in their city. Several loans from Nor Horizon, and one already from Kiva, have helped him to enlarge his business and increase his family income as well.

Hamlet is asking for a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables for his stall.
