She requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings to improve her harvest and increase her income. In the future,Teodora would like to improve her farming business to be able to provide healthy diets and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 45 years old and married to Martha. They have three children, 18, 15, and 12 years old.

George has been operating a posho mill in Naivasha for the past 18 years and he has applied for his second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him put up a biogas engine which will be helpful for his business. He plans to pay school fees and cater to his family's needs with the anticipated profit.

George hopes to see his children well-educated and to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To put up a biogas engine for his posho mill.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 32-year-old man from Usenge, which is in the Western part of Kenya. He is married with a 3-year-old child. For the past 10 years, Frederick has been a fisherman to support his family. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Frederick is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase more fishing nets. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to grow his business. Frederick's dream is to open another business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 36 years old and married to Jane. He is the father of three children. For the past eight years, Cyrus has raised pigs and worked as a mixed-crop farmer in Kiambu. He earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

Cyrus is requesting his second loan with KADET LTD to buy animal feed for his pigs and poultry. In the future, he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs and poultry

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and the father of eight children. Reynaldo has been in the fishing business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of his income. Reynaldo is requesting a loan to buy a new engine for his fishing boat. With the new engine, Reynaldo will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to make his fishing venture a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 28-year-old businessman who is married to Priscilla. He runs a butchery business. He also operates a hotel business and a taxi business to supplement his income. He currently lacks sufficient funds to purchase enough meat to serve his ever-growing customer base. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, Simon will be able to purchase more cows for slaughter and sell the meat in his butcher shop. Simon is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced by an existing KADET client. Additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. 

In the future, Simon would like to have children and start investing in his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for slaughter

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and married with one child who is eight months old.

He has a clinic in Naivasha which he has operated for the past two years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a lab microscope and add to his medicine stock. He plans to open a chemist's shop with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Emmanuel hopes to open a hospital so as give back to the community by alleviating pain and suffering as well as offering better services to patients.

loans.use: To buy a microscope and medicines.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is married, 48 years old, and has three children. He lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. 

He is a farmer who plants and harvests corn and bananas to earn a living. Every other week, he sells his harvested bananas in town. 

He joined Gata Daku MPC to gain access to microfinance services and is requesting a loan to cover the costs of replanting bananas and weeding maintenance. He is thankful for this loan for it helps him to expand his banana farm and he hopes to gain an abundant harvest in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of replanting bananas and weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 52 year old, married, and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer.

In order to help to improve their quality of life, she runs a general store, selling goods in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. She joined Gata Daku MPC and recently borrowed a loan to  purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale. She plans to saved a portion of her generated income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale.

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. The family is residing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

It's been Jonard's dream to own a motorcycle for subsistence, which was brought into reality through hard work and determination. Since then, he has actively driven and sent passengers to designated areas safely. It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too.

Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy tires and finance the costs to renew licenses and registration. The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, Jonard is expecting to pursue his job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 50 years old and married with five children who are in school.

He has a welding business in Naivasha which he has operated for the past four years and has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a welding machine. He plans to pay school fees and cater for his family needs with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Harrison hopes to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old and married with two children, aged 24 and 17 years old.

She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 22 years and has applied for her seventh loan from KADET LTD to enable her to pay school fees after paying her previous loan on time. 

She hopes to continue borrowing loans from KADET LTD so as to boost her farming business and educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 38-year-old married man who supports a nephew who is in secondary school.

Benson has been selling shoes for the past five years and has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy more shoes to add to his stock.

He hopes to be financially stable in the future and to expand his shoes business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and married to Peter. They have children who are in school.

She is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her fourth loan from Kadet ltd to enable her to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor during this planting season. She repaid her previous loan on time. 

With her anticipated profit, she hopes to expand her farming business to improve her family's living standards and to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
This is Jenalyn, 38, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jonjie, a worker abroad, and they have children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jenalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jenalyn hopes that her variety store will be a grocery store and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en: Mwanatumu is a married woman and lives with her husband in a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water. She has two children, one goes to school and the other is still very young. Mwanatumu has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business for the past year. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned that the high cost of transportation is her major business challenge. With the KES15,000 loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase firewood and two sacks of charcoal to sell. Mwanatumu dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and two sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has been blessed with five children who go to school. For the past year, she has operated a shop where she sells household consumables to local customers. Mejumaa owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. 

Mejumaa is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kongo

texts.en:
Kongo is married and blessed with three children who attend school. She works cooking food to sell at the market to town dwellers and passersby. Kongo's major business challenge is leftover food causing losses. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Kongo decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

Kongo is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. In the future, she dreams of establishing a café business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil
